original: On Clavicus Vile
string: 关于克拉维库斯·维尔

original:
[pagebreak]

On Clavicus Vile By Calithar Gaeus [pagebreak]

ay this book serve as a warning to all who dare bargain with the Prince of Trickery. Heed my words and do not tread the path I followed, for all that awaits you is a lifetime of misery. [pagebreak] lavicus Vile, the Child-god of the Morningstar, is above all else a Daedric Prince. He is not your saviour, nor is he caring of your fate. To him, you are naught but entertainment, to be used and discarded at his whims. His promises are empty, and any gift he bears is a lure into deep waters. [pagebreak] e is a conniving being, one capable of immense deceit, be it with his honeyed words or with his loyal hound, Barbas. The latter is merely an extension of himself, a shattering of Vile's power done before time itself. The dog may be its own entity, but it does not care for you and shall always harbour its master's whims at heart. [pagebreak] have studied countless cases of Vile's deals and seen the horror he inflicts upon his victims. From eternal damnation to a lifetime of grief, he will stop at nothing to extract every ounce of pain from you. You are a mere avenue of entertainment to him, and you must know this. [pagebreak] espite my stern warnings, I am not exempt from this folly. I myself have fallen for the Prince's trickery. In a moment of weakness, Clavicus took everything from me. My wife, my child, and my home. I lost everything. This is why I beg of you, do not bargain with the Prince of Trickery; a lifetime of pain is all that awaits you. [pagebreak]

Beware this face. Heed my warnings. [pagebreak]

For my Thaliel and Valion. I miss you both. Calithar
string:
[pagebreak]

关于克拉维库斯·维尔 作者：卡利萨·盖斯 [pagebreak]

愿这本书成为和那些与欺诈王子交易的人的警告。谨记我的话语，不要踏上我走过的道路，因为等待你的只会是终身的痛苦。 [pagebreak] 晨星之子克拉维库斯·维尔最重要的是一个迪德拉王子。他不是你的救世主，也不在乎你的命运。对他来说，你只是供他消遣的对象，可以随他心情利用和抛弃。他的诺言是空洞的，他带来的任何礼物都是引诱入深水的诱饵。 [pagebreak] 他是一个狡诈的存在，可以通过他那蜜般言语或他忠实的猎犬巴巴斯进行极大的欺骗。后者只是他自己的延伸，维尔的力量在时间开始之前就已经碎裂。这条狗可能是自己的实体，但它不在乎你，总是心怀主人的心意。 [pagebreak] 我研究了无数维尔的交易案例，看到他对受害者施加的恐怖。无论是永世的诅咒还是终生的悲伤，他将不择手段地从你身上抽取每一丝痛苦。对他来说，你只是他的消遣，你必须明白这一点。 [pagebreak] 尽管我严厉警告，我自己也无法逃脱这愚蠢。我自己也曾上了那位王子的欺骗。在一时的软弱中，克拉维斯夺走了我的一切。我的妻子，我的孩子，我的家园。我失去了一切。这就是为什么我恳求你，不要和欺诈王子交易；终身的痛苦等待你。 [pagebreak]

小心这张脸。听从我的警告。 [pagebreak]

献给我的萨里尔和瓦利昂。想念你们两个。 卡利萨

original:
<font size='25'><font face='$DaedricFont'>
Feel the grass beneath your feet, hear the birds singing beside you. Taste the cool morning air and smell the scent of the forest. Look upon the heavens and the courage to speak unto the universe, I. The illusions shall shatter; the preconceived shall fall apart around you. Even in the face of this unwavering void, insist, I.
string:
<font size='25'><font face='$DaedricFont'>
感受脚下的草地，听到身边鸟儿的歌唱。品味清晨的凉飕气息，闻到森林的气味。看向苍穹，勇敢地向宇宙言语，我。幻觉将破裂；先入为主的观念将在你周围崩溃。即使在这个不动摇的虚空面前，我坚持。

original: Veteran's First Journal
string: 退伍老兵的第一本日记

original:
<font face='$HandwrittenFont'><font size='16'>
[Any words once present within the first entries are now no more than splotches of faded ink. Holding the ripped page within your hands and you feel it are stiff with traces of water and mildew.]

17th Second Seed, 4E 176
Imperial patrol deemed me fit for a visit today. Was half tempted to ignore their knocking but no, I had the kindness in me to let them in.  Once I sat back down, bastards had the gall to ask how I fared. Didn't they have eyes, could they not see how I hobbled over to the door?! No more than carved table legs, only good for sitting in this damned chair.

I don't give a skeever's arse if they lost their friends in the war, everyone on Tamriel did! Even dared to say they recognised my sacrifice, Shor's balls did they recognise it! They could at least stand up and walk to the door.

Those bastards didn't suffer, I did.

[There's countless entries with single words written beneath dates.]

3rd Sun's Dusk, 4E 183
Can't even stomach going outside anymore. No sense in watching the deer meander around my home, only reminds me of how easily I could have hunted those bastards down. When I had my legs, Nine I was quick. Could have chased that thing down and stabbed it to death with my own dagger.

Divines how I miss wandering these lands. Words can't describe how much I miss sleeping beneath the pines or feeling the warm sand beneath my feet. Now all I can do is stare at these trophies and drink my sorrows away. 

[There's dozens of entries across the years detailing his continued nightmares. One in particular stands out to you. The words are skewed and you notice multiple errors within the entry]

12th Rain's Hand, 4E 193
Bastard nightmars, woke up screaming.

I feel the fire eatin away at my legs, slowly craling all the way up my uniform. For a monent, I think it bloccks out all the screaming but then I hear Curo's sobing. He falls just inn front of me. I try drag him with me, son start smelling the metal in the blood. Starts poring into my legs, puts out the fire but the screaming only gets louder. Soon covers m mouth. Then all I here are the screams.

[The entries past this are mostly unintelligible lines, likely meant to be a form of writing. However, the final entry differs.]

18th Last Seed, 4E 199
I'm not letting these cursed legs keep me for any longer. Got Nanya to give me a book on this Daedra, Clavicus Vile. He's supposed to grant wishes. That bastard better hold up his end of the bargain.

</font>
string:
[任何先前在第一项中存在的文字现在不过是褪色的墨迹斑点。你握着撕裂的页面，感觉上面沾满了水迹和霉味。]

第16年Second Seed，17E 4
帝国巡逻队认为今天我适合拜访。差点忍不住不理他们的敲门声，但是，我善良地让他们进来了。一坐下来，这帮混蛋竟然问我过得如何。他们难道没有眼睛吗，看不到我是怎么一瘸一拐地走到门口的吗？就像木质桌腿一样，只适合坐在这该死的椅子上。

他们在战争中失去了朋友，我才不在乎呢，泰姆瑞尔上的每个人都失去了！甚至还敢说他们认识我的牺牲，勇者的球，他们怎么认识的！至少能够站起来走到门口。

那帮混蛋们没有受过苦，我才受了。

【日期下有数不清的词汇】

176年Sun's Dusk，3E 4
我甚至已经无法忍受再出门了。看着鹿在我家周围漫步毫无意义，只会让我想起我本可以多么轻松地追捕那帮混蛋。当我还有双腿时，我曾经是敏捷的。本来可以追着那个东西并用我的匕首刺死它。

神明啊，我是多么怀念闲逛在这片土地上。无法用言语描述我有多么怀念在松树下睡觉或感受脚底下温暖的沙子。现在我所能做的就是凝视这些战利品并饮酒消愁。

【有数十年份的项目详述他持续的噩梦。其中一个让你格外注意。这些文字扭曲，你注意到条目中有多处错误】

183年Rain's Hand，12E 4
混蛋的噩梦，惊醒大喊。

我感到火慢慢啃食我的双腿，慢慢爬上我的军服。有一瞬间，我以为它将所有的尖叫声都掩盖，但然后我听到库洛的哭泣声。他就在我面前倒下。我尝试拖着他，儿子开始闻到血液中的金属味。开始倾入我的双腿，扑灭火焰，但尖叫声只变得更大声。很快覆盖住我的嘴。之后我只听到尖叫声。

【这之后的条目大多是难以理解的句子，可能是一种书面形式。然而，最后一项有所不同。】

193年Last Seed，18E 4
这些可诅咒的双腿不能再阻拦我了。找到了Nanya给我一本关于达德拉克拉维库斯·维尔的书。他应该会实现愿望。那混蛋最好遵守承诺。

<font face='$HandwrittenFont'>

original: Journal Fragment #5
string: 日记碎片＃5

original:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="16">
12th Sun's Height
We still can't decide, moons are approaching full. Not much time left.

14th Sun's Height
Remus got out of his cell, Magnus gave himself up so we could get behind the barricades.

Can't do this anymore, the old man has to die.

15th Sun's Height
Seems both Amul and me got cut in all the commotion. I don't know how this beast magic works but I pray to the Divines we'll be safe.
</font>
string:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="16">
16日之光季
我们还是无法决定，月亮快要圆满。时间不多了。

12日之光季
雷穆斯逃出了牢房，马格努斯主动投降以便我们能够冲破壁垒。

我再也不能忍受了，老人必须死。

14日之光季
似乎我和阿穆尔在混乱中受了伤。我不知道这些野兽魔法是如何运作的，但我向神灵祈祷我们会平安无事。
</font>

original: Olen's Journal
string: 奥伦的日记

original:
<font face='$HandwrittenFont'><font size='16'>
[Half the pages of the journal are torn out, though the remaining strands of paper indicate it was done by the hands of a human]

2nd Rain's Hand
We've found a spot to hunker down until we can figure this all out. Not a soul's seen us entering and it's well hidden from prying eyes, only person we've seen around is an old man in a cabin. So long as we steer clear of him, we should be able to remain hidden, at least for the time being.

Still can't believe it went down like that. I know Remus was just looking out for us, but it still doesn't sit right with me.

27th Rain's Hand
We set up a prison for Remus in case he can't control his urges. Luckily haven't had to use it yet but if he does transform again, it'll save all our heads.

Things have calmed down at the very least, enough times passed that we can start getting some real rest. Still, we gotta stick to hunting and foraging at night to avoid spooking the old man. Romul claimed he chased a deer down on his own two legs, not that it meant much to me but the others said it's quite the feat.

8th Second Seed
Silvio managed to gather some mountain flowers, lavender, dragon's tongue, not the greatest selection but it's all we can get out here. The others think it'll be enough to try cleanse Remus' body from Oblivion knows what was in that potion but I'm sure none of it'll work.

They still think it's just a bit more hair and a mean streak, they didn't see what he looked like, or what he did to the mage. Remus doesn't care to correct them either, he just spends his time staring at the water below. I see the moons, I think he feels the transformation coming. For our sake, I hope that cell holds him.

24th Second Seed
Old man got a glimpse of us as we returned from hunting. We put on a good facade, hopefully he just thinks we're travellers.

5th Mid Year
Remus turned last night.

He managed to hold off for a time, let us lock him well before night actually fell. Half soiled myself when I saw it all happen though, his skin bulging, muscles ripping and the veins growing, was the first time I saw it happen clearly. I doubt Remus even knew who we were, had a wildness to his eyes that I only saw on the other night, suppose it's just part of the transformation.

We knew the cell would hold but all the howling and rattling he did was bound to send the deer into a frenzy. We can hope all the running that old man does makes him sleep soundly at night, else he might come to investigate.

Plants are growing nicely though I'm starting to miss the village. Not that it really matters, they wouldn't take us back, not after Remus' bloody stint with the mage. Bastards could only chase us with the pitchforks cause of us, else that wizard would have cast hexes on the lot of them.

13th Mid Year
Moons are gonna be full soon, need to be careful.

27th Mid Year
Silvio's dead. Had to barricade ourselves in to stop Remus from getting us.

If it happened once, it could happen again. We need to do something.

2nd Sun's Height
Amul's heard stories of people summoning Clavicus Vile, says he'll get a cure for Remus. Can't shake the idea it's all gonna go wrong, not fancying talking to a brother of the one who caused all this. Still, it's the only chance we have, I suppose it's the only chance we have.

6th Sun's Height, 4E 201
Been days since Amul tried contacting the Daedra, no sign of him. 

I've seen the old man walking around the lake recently. Might need to scare him, might make him second guess investigating this.

9th Sun's Height
Some beggar covered in dirt arrived while we slept, even Remus didn't hear his footsteps. We know he's a messenger for Vile, made it clear enough himself when he was standing above my bed when I awoke.

Bastard named his price, said the old man has to die if Remus wants his humanity back.

I don't think I can bring myself to do it, will have to speak to the others.

12th Sun's Height
We still can't decide, moons are approaching full. Not much time left.

14th Sun's Height
Remus got out of his cell, Magnus gave himself up so we could get behind the barricades.

Can't do this anymore, the old man has to die.

15th Sun's Height
Seems both Amul and me got cut in all the commotion. I don't know how this beast magic works but I pray to the Divines we'll be safe.</font>
string:
[半数日记页面被撕毁，残存的纸张表明这是人类之手所为]

雨手办第二天
我们找到了一个藏身之处，直到我们能搞清楚这一切。没有人看到我们进入，它被很好地隐藏在偷窥的眼睛之外，我们周围唯一看到的人是一个小屋里的老人。只要我们远离他，我们应该能保持隐藏，至少暂时。

还是无法相信事情会这样发生。我知道Remus只是在为我们着想，但这件事仍然让我不舒服。

雨手办第27天
我们为Remus建立了一个监狱，以防他无法控制自己的冲动。幸运的是，我们还没有用过，但如果他再次变形，这将挽救我们所有人的性命。

事情至少已经平静下来了，足够的时间已经过去了，我们可以开始真正休息一下。不过，我们必须继续在晚上狩猎和觅食，以避免吓到老人。罗穆声称他用自己的双腿追赶了一只鹿，这对我来说并不重要，但其他人说这是一项了不起的壮举。

第二种子的第8天
Silvio设法收集了一些山地花朵、薰衣草、龙舌草，并不是最好的选择，但这是我们能在这里得到的一切。其他人认为这足够尝试净化Remus的身体，天知道那瓶药中有什么，但我肯定其中没有任何有效成分。

他们仍然认为这只是多了点毛发和凶猛的倾向，他们没有看到他的样子，也没有看到他对法师做了什么。Remus也不在乎纠正他们，他只是把时间花在凝视下面的水上。我看到了月亮，我想他感觉到了变身的来临。为了我们自己好，我希望那个牢房能把他困住。

第二种子的第24天
老人看到我们从狩猎归来时瞥见了我们。我们装出了一副好样子，希望他只是觉得我们是旅行者。

年中的第5天
昨晚Remus变身了。

他设法坚持了一段时间，让我们在天黑之前把他锁好。当我看到一切发生时，我几乎吓破了胆，他的皮肤膨胀，肌肉撕裂，静脉生长，这是我第一次清楚地看到发生的情况。我怀疑Remus甚至不知道我们是谁，他的眼睛中有一种疯狂，我只在另一天晚上见过，这可能是变身的一部分。

我们知道牢房会把他困住，但他发出的吼叫和哗哗声肯定会使鹿疯狂。我们希望老人所有的奔跑会让他晚上睡得安稳，否则他可能会过来调查。

植物长得很好，不过我开始怀念村庄。不过这并不真的重要，他们不会接纳我们，尤其是在Remus与法师的血腥冲突之后。家伙们只能用草叉追赶我们，否则那位巫师会对他们所有人施法放咒。

年中的第13天
月亮很快就会圆，我们需要小心。

年中的第27天
Silvio死了。我们不得不设法封锁自己，以防Remus伤害我们。

如果发生一次，那就有可能再次发生。我们需要做些什么。

日高的第2天
Amul听说过人们召唤克拉维库斯·维利的故事，说他会为Remus找到救治之法。我无法摆脱这一切都会出错的想法，不愿意与这个造成一切的人的兄弟交谈。不过，这是我们唯一的机会，我想这是我们唯一的机会。

日高的第6天，第4E201
Amul尝试联系邪神已经过去几天了，没有任何消息。

我最近看见老人在湖边走动。也许需要吓唬他，这样他可能会三思是否调查这件事。

日高的第9天
我们睡觉时来了一个满身污垢的乞丐，连Remus都没听到他的脚步声。我们知道他是维利的信使，当我从床上醒来时，他自己也表明了这一点。

混蛋规定了他的价格，说老人必须死才能让Remus恢复人性。

我不认为我能做这件事，将不得不与其他人商议。

日高的第12天
我们仍然无法决定，月亮即将圆满。时间不多了。

日高的第14天
Remus从牢房中逃了出来，马格努斯为了让我们能够躲到壁垒后面而放弃了自己。

我再也无法忍受这一切了，老人必须死。

日高的第15天
看来Amul和我在所有的混乱中受了伤。我不知道这种野兽魔法是如何运作的，但我祈祷神灵保佑我们平安。 <font face='$HandwrittenFont'>

original: Letter to Leo
string: 给李奥的信

original:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="18">
Leo,

I know it's been a while since we last spoke but I wanted to reach out. I should have done it sooner but things have been rather hectic for me with Althea moving into the home. We've spent the past weeks rearrnanging the house from head to toe, clearing out old furniture and bringing the new pieces in. She's particular with it all, as I'm sure you know. 
[pagebreak]
Enough about me, how have you been faring these days? I take it Selene is doing well and you're still head over heels for her? And the fishing business, how's that been treating you?
[pagebreak]
Write back to me when you have the chance, I'd love to hear from you.
Nanning
</font>
string:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="18">
李奥，请原谅我这么久没有和你联系，但我想和你联系。我本该早点做的，但因为阿尔西亚搬进居所，我的生活变得很忙碌。过去几周我们从头到尾重新布置了房子，清理了旧家具，换进新的。她对这一切都很在意，我相信你知道。 
[pagebreak]
不说我了，你这些日子怎么样？我想塞琳过得不错，你仍然深爱着她吗？还有捕鱼生意，那怎么样？
[pagebreak]
有机会给我回信，我会很高兴听到你的消息。
Nanning
</font>

original: Nanning's Plea
string: 南宁的请求

original:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="18">
Leo,
I'm sorry to hear about Selene; I know how much she meant to you. She was loved by everyone, me and Althea especially, and she'll be dearly missed. I can't imagine how you must feel, but please, don't hesitate to reach out to me and say what you need to; I won't judge you for it.
[pagebreak]
I don't mean to come off as invasive or rude; I write this as a dear friend, someone who's concerned for your wellbeing. Please, try to take your mind off it. I know you like your solitude, but sitting in that swamp fishing all day isn't healthy. I know you, going over the accident again and again, wondering what you could have done differently. Please, go to Solitude; clear your head. You could tour the city and spend your nights in the Winking Skeever. By Talos, I'll pay for it all myself. Please, just don't waste away in that damned swamp.

Wishing you all the best.
Nanning
</font>
string:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="18">
李奥，很抱歉听到塞琳的消息；我知道她对你意味着多少。她受到了所有人的爱，特别是我和阿尔西亚，我们将深深思念她。我无法想象你现在的感受，但请不要犹豫联系我，说出你需要说的。我不会因此而评判你。
[pagebreak]
我并不是要冒昧或粗鲁，我是作为一位亲密的朋友告诉你，我关心你的健康。请试着放下心中的烦忧。我知道你喜欢独处，但整天坐在沼泽里钓鱼并不健康。我了解你，一遍又一遍地回想事故，想知道你能做些什么不同。请，去索丹城；头脑清醒。你可以参观城市，晚上可以在眨眼杆客栈过夜。天啊，我自己来买单。请，不要在那该死的沼泽中虚度光阴。
祝你一切顺利。
南宁
</font>

original: Journal Fragment #4
string: 日记碎片＃4

original:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="16">
27th Mid Year
Silvio's dead. Had to barricade ourselves in to stop Remus from getting us.

If it happened once, it could happen again. We need to do something.

2nd Sun's Height
Amul's heard stories of people summoning Clavicus Vile, says he'll get a cure for Remus. Can't shake the idea it's all gonna go wrong, not fancying talking to a brother of the one who caused all this. Still, it's the only chance we have, I suppose it's the only chance we have.

6th Sun's Height, 4E 201
Been days since Amul tried contacting the Daedra, no sign of him. 

I've seen the old man walking around the lake recently. Might need to scare him, might make him second guess investigating this.

9th Sun's Height
Some beggar covered in dirt arrived while we slept, even Remus didn't hear his footsteps. We know he's a messenger for Vile, made it clear enough himself when he was standing above my bed when I awoke.

Bastard named his price, said the old man has to die if Remus wants his humanity back.

I don't think I can bring myself to do it, will have to speak to the others.
</font>
string:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="16">
第16年仲夏
希尔维奥已经去世了。不得不设法用栅栏挡住雷姆斯。一旦发生，可能再次发生。我们需要采取行动。

original: Journal Fragment #3
string: 日记碎片＃3

original:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="16">
5th Mid Year
Remus turned last night.

He managed to hold off for a time, let us lock him well before night actually fell. Half soiled myself when I saw it all happen though, his skin bulging, muscles ripping and the veins growing, was the first time I saw it happen clearly. I doubt Remus even knew who we were, had a wildness to his eyes that I only saw on the other night, suppose it's just part of the transformation.

We knew the cell would hold but all the howling and rattling he did was bound to send the deer into a frenzy. We can hope all the running that old man does makes him sleep soundly at night, else he might come to investigate.

Plants are growing nicely though I'm starting to miss the village. Not that it really matters, they wouldn't take us back, not after Remus' bloody stint with the mage. Bastards could only chase us with the pitchforks cause of us, else that wizard would have cast hexes on the lot of them.

13th Mid Year
Moons are gonna be full soon, need to be careful.

</font>
string:
夏日第五天 雷姆斯昨晚变了。他设法在一段时间内承受住，让我们在夜幕降临之前好好锁住他。但我看到一切发生时有一半把自己弄脏了，他的皮肤膨胀，肌肉撕裂，血管生长，我第一次清楚地看到这一切发生。我怀疑雷姆斯甚至不知道我们是谁，眼睛里有一种狂野，我只在另一天晚上见过，这可能是变异的一部分。

我们知道牢房会挡住，但他发出的嚎叫和震动必然会让鹿陷入疯狂。我们只能希望老人晚上好好睡觉，否则他可能会来调查。

植物生长得很好，尽管我开始怀念村庄。事实上并不重要，他们不会收留我们，不会原谅雷姆斯与法师的血腥事件。混蛋们只能用干草叉追赶我们，否则那个巫师会对他们施放咒语。

夏月13日 月亮很快就会圆，需要小心。

<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="16">

original: Journal Fragment #2
string: 日记碎片＃2

original:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="16">
8th Second Seed
Silvio managed to gather some mountain flowers, lavender, dragon's tongue, not the greatest selection but it's all we can get out here. The others think it'll be enough to try cleanse Remus' body from Oblivion knows what was in that potion but I'm sure none of it'll work.

They still think it's just a bit more hair and a mean streak, they didn't see what he looked like, or what he did to the mage. Remus doesn't care to correct them either, he just spends his time staring at the water below. I see the moons, I think he feels the transformation coming. For our sake, I hope that cell holds him.

24th Second Seed
Old man got a glimpse of us as we returned from hunting. We put on a good facade, hopefully he just thinks we're travellers.

</font>
string:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="16">
第16个霜降月
席尔维奥设法收集了一些山花，薰衣草，龙之舌，选择不是最好的，但这就是我们在这里能得到的。其他人以为这足够尝试净化雷姆斯的身体，谁知道那个药水里有什么，但我肯定其中任何一样都不会起作用。

他们仍然认为这只是多了一点毛发和一个坏脾气，他们没看到他的样子，或者他对法师做了什么。雷姆斯也不在乎纠正他们，他只是把时间花在盯着下面的水。我看到了月亮，我觉得他感觉到了变化即将来临。希望那个牢房能关住他们两个的缘故。

第8个霜降月
老人看到我们从狩猎归来。我们装出了一副好面孔，希望他只是认为我们是旅行者。

</font>

original: Veteran's Second Journal
string: 老兵的第二本日志

original:
<font face='$HandwrittenFont'><font size='16'>
19th Last Seed, 4E 200
They're back, my legs are back!

Last night, I called out to the Prince, told him I've suffered for long enough and I came to bargain. Spent hours howling my lungs out, hoping he'd hear my cries.

Just this morning, some mangy beggar knocks on my door and says he has a gift for me. He was an ugly feller, stank of the city but in his hands were a pair of expertly crafted wooden legs. Not sure how he made them himself, the finest woodworkers in the Empire couldn't hope to make something like them. Still, the beggar said they would let me wander the woods once more and allow me to walk as I once did.

They bend and move as if they were crafted from flesh and bone, and they're mighty warm to the touch. I don't wish to know what magic he put in them but by the Nine he was right, bastards work even better than my old legs! Already killed a deer with no more than the legs and a dagger!

1st Morning Star, 4E 201
Paid a visit to the nearby lake and after a few hours of waiting, felled a mighty stag. Already started a fire beneath the trees, even used my old legs as kindling. Seeing those cursed things burn did more for me than any mead could.

I'll sleep under the pines tonight and continue my hunt in the morning. Life is good.

25th Second Seed, 4E 201
Folks keep passing by the lake, not seen any of their kind before. Seem friendly enough, though I don't want them learning about my new legs, not sure what would happen if they did.

12th Mid Year, 4E 201
The dreams have returned, though now I can finally stand up from the pool of blood. I still meet my end of course but it's different, that's what matters.

Tried speaking with some of those people I've been seeing, no luck though. Bastards have something off about them, I know it, might be running a skooma rink nearby. If they try anything, I'll cut them down, that I'm certain of.

6th Sun's Height, 4E 201
Something's off. Had a nightmare, quite a bad one too and I awoke with blood on my palm.

It's not just me that's troubled, the deer seem affected too. I saw a doe pacing around the lake and when I went to check on it, it led me to a stag with a log through its chest.

I know it's not that bastard's magic coming back for me but I still can't shake it. Coming on a year since I've had these legs now and it's got me jumpy. Just need a bit of mead to calm me down.

11th Last Seed, 4E 201
Can't sleep, not with the year coming to an end so soon. Half tempted to burn these legs now but I can't bring myself to do it.

Need to leave the house and calm down. Being trapped here won't do me any good.

19th Last Seed, 4E 201
I'm safe! That bastard hasn't come for me! Waited all day hidden behind that door, if he'd have come for them, only thing he would have got is an axe to his skull.

I'll celebrate come morning. I fancy a hunt by the lake, might even see if any game travel into that cave. Doesn't matter, I've got the time to do whatever I want!</font>
string:
4E 200年第19个最后的种子月，他们回来了，我的腿回来了！

昨晚，我呼唤那位亲王，告诉他我已经受苦够久，我来交易了。大声狂吠了几个小时，希望他听到我的哭声。

就在今天早上，一个邋遢的乞丐敲响了我的门，告诉我他有个礼物送给我。他长得很难看，身上有城市的臭味，但他手中拿着一双制作精良的木腿。我不确定他是自己做的，帝国最好的木匠也不可能做出这样的东西。然而，那个乞丐说他们会让我重新在树林中漫步，并允许我像过去一样行走。

它们弯曲而移动，就像它们是由血肉和骨头制成的，手感十分温暖。我不想知道他们里面加了什么魔法，但是天，他说得对，这些家伙比我的老腿还要好！仅仅用腿和匕首就已经猎杀了一只鹿！

4E 201年第1个晨星，我去附近的湖看看，等待几个小时后，猎杀了一只强壮的雄鹿。已经在树下生起了火，甚至用我的旧腿做柴火。看到那些被诅咒的东西燃烧给了我更多安慰，超过了任何蜜酒。

今晚我会在松树下睡觉，明天继续打猎。生活真是美好。

4E 201年第25个种子月，人们一直在湖边经过，从未见过他们这样的人。他们看起来很友好，尽管我不希望他们知道我的新腿，不确定如果他们知道会发生什么。

4E 201年第12个年中月，梦回归了，不过现在我终于能从血泊中站起来。当然我还是会死去，但这是不同的，这才重要。

试图和那些我看到的人们交谈，不过不成功。这帮家伙有点奇怪，我知道，可能在附近经营一家管教魔药的地方。如果他们做点什么，我会毫不犹豫地砍了他们，这是确定的。

4E 201年第6个太阳高月，有什么不对劲。做了一个噩梦，而且很糟糕，醒来时手掌上有血迹。

不仅是我在困扰，连鹿也受到影响。我看到一只母鹿在湖边踱步，当我去检查时，它带我去了一只胸口被树枝穿透的雄鹿。

我知道那不是那该死的魔法回来找我的，但我仍然摆脱不了。自从我有这些腿以来已经接近一年了，我变得很紧张。只需要一点蜜酒来平静下来。

4E 201年第11个最后的种子月，睡不着，因为这一年即将结束。有半数的冲动要把这些腿烧了，但我做不到。

需要离开房子冷静下来。被困在这里对我毫无好处。

4E 201年第19个最后的种子月，我平安了！那家伙没有来找我！整天躲在那扇门后等待，如果他来找他们，唯一的下场就是头颅被我的斧头砍掉。

明天早晨我会庆祝。我想去湖边打猎，甚至看看是否有猎物进入了那个洞穴。无所谓了，我有时间做任何想做的事!<font face='$HandwrittenFont'>

original: Witch's Journal
string: 巫师日志

original:
<font face='$HandwrittenFont'><font size='18'>
21st of Sun's Dusk, 4E 196 
I have found an abandoned cabin within the outer reaches of Morthal's swamp. It is secluded enough that I won�t be disturbed by any curious locals and as fate would have it, a corpse already rests within the home. It is a fine host for my cultivation. Peryite is truly watching over me. 

27th of Sun's Dusk, 4E 196 
For days I have dined on the foulest of food. From rotten meat harbouring colonies of mould, to mushrooms embedded with diseases from all over Tamriel. My stomach was no more than a breeding ground for my Lord, and he has sired the finest of heirs. The body has been prepared, and I have exhumed the foul humours within me. It is now only a matter of time.

 21st of Evening Star, 4E 196 
Not only do I smell my child festering within the host, I see the beginnings of his metamorphosis. He has begun to develop roots, seeking solace within the embrace of the earth. I shall tend to his wishes every waking moment. I shall not displease my Lord. 

4th of Morning Star, 4E 197 
My child has already begun to take root within the home. His tendrils have pierced the floorboards, and I see his limbs branching into the walls themselves. Though my body has begun to wither, I tend to his every whim. Soon, I shall live within him, the finest fate I could dare ask of my Lord!

5th of Morning Star, 4E 197
My child now festers deep beneath the earth! The creatures of the underground see his splendour, and he reigns under the guidance of my dear Peryite. Though I shall not live to see it, I die knowing my son prospers within this cruel world. He will soon consume my corpse and use it as fuel for his conquest of Skyrim.

6th of Morning Star, 4E 197
I join Peryite at his side, a humble concubine in his illustrious empire. Our heir promised all of Tamriel.

</font>
string:
太阳的第21天，第四纪元196年 我在墨索尔沼泽边缘发现了一间废弃的小屋。它非常隐蔽，没有任何好奇的当地人会打扰我，正巧，屋内已经有一具尸体。这是我培养的好地方。帕瑞特确实在看着我。

太阳的第27天，第四纪元196年 几天来，我只吃最腐臭的食物。从腐烂的肉产生的霉菌，到带有泰姆瑞尔各地疾病的蘑菇。我的肚子不过是我主人的繁殖场，他已经生出了最优秀的继承人。尸体已经准备好，我已经排出了体内的恶浊。现在只是时间的问题。

第21天晚星，第四纪元196年 我不仅能闻到孩子在宿主体内滋长，还看到他开始变形。他已经开始发展根系，寻求地球的怀抱。我将每时每刻满足他的愿望。我不会让我主人失望。

第四日，第四纪元197年 我的孩子已经开始在屋内生根。他的卷须穿透地板，我看到他的肢体伸向墙壁。虽然我的身体开始枯萎，我会满足他的每一个愿望。很快，我将活在他里面，这是我向主人提出的最好命运！

第五日，第四纪元197年 我的孩子现在深埋在地底深处！地下生物看到他的荣光，他在我亲爱的帕瑞特的指导下统治着这个残酷的世界。尽管我不能活着看到，但我死的时候知道我的儿子在这个残酷的世界上茁壮成长。他很快会消耗我的尸体，用它作为征服天际的燃料。

第六日，第四纪元197年 我加入帕瑞特的身边，成为他辉煌帝国中的谦卑妾。我们的继承者承诺了整个泰姆瑞尔。

<font face='$HandwrittenFont'>

original: Ulfgar's Letter
string: 乌尔夫加的信

original:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="15">

To my beautiful Leona,

Ever since I made that bargain, I am no longer the man you fell in love with.

When I first died, it started off as a deep longing for something I couldn't describe. I thought spending more time with you and Lucia would fill the void inside of me, but I was wrong. So I left you two for a time, took more contracts and tried to fill the hole with bloodshed. That's when I died again.

After that, the longing only grew within me. It sucked the joy out of your laugh and the love out of Lucia's eyes. The walks around Whiterun we once adored felt lifeless and mundane. I tried to ignore it at first and assume who I once was. I couldn't.

Even now, there is something inside of me, a flame of love for the two of you. I hope you know how much that means to me.

I write this as I ride out of Whiterun; forgive me.

</font>
string:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="15">
亲爱的莉奥娜，
自从我达成那个交易以来，我已不再是你爱上的那个男人。
当我第一次死去时，只是深深地渴望着某种无法描述的东西。我以为多花些时间与你和露西亚在一起会填补我内心的空虚，但我错了。所以我离开了你们一段时间，接了更多的合同，试图用流血来填满内心的空洞。那时我又死去了。
之后，内心的渴望只是在我内心膨胀。它抽走了你的笑声中的快乐，露西亚眼中的爱意。我们曾经喜爱的环绕白漫的散步变得毫无生气和平淡。我起初试图忽视它，想当年那个我。但我做不到。
即使现在，我内心深处有某种力量，一种对你们两人的爱的火焰。我希望你知道这对我意味着多少。
当我从白漫城骑马离开时，我写下了这封信；请原谅我。
</font>

original:
<font face='$HandwrittenFont'><font size='16'>
[Half the pages of the journal are torn out, though the remaining strands of paper indicate it was done by the hands of a human]

2nd Rain's Hand
We've found a spot to hunker down until we can figure this all out. Not a soul's seen us entering and it's well hidden from prying eyes, only person we've seen around is an old man in a cabin. So long as we steer clear of him, we should be able to remain hidden, at least for the time being.

Still can't believe it went down like that. I know Remus was just looking out for us, but it still doesn't sit right with me.

27th Rain's Hand
We set up a prison for Remus in case he can't control his urges. Luckily haven't had to use it yet but if he does transform again, it'll save all our heads.

Things have calmed down at the very least, enough times passed that we can start getting some real rest. Still, we gotta stick to hunting and foraging at night to avoid spooking the old man. Romul claimed he chased a deer down on his own two legs, not that it meant much to me but the others said it's quite the feat.

</font>
string:
<font face='$HandwrittenFont'><font size='16'>
[日记的一半页面撕掉了，剩余的纸端指示是由人类的手来执行的]

16雨之手月
我们找到了一个躲避处，待我们能理清一切。没有人看到我们进来，藏得很好，不会被窥视，周围只有一个小屋里的老人。只要我们远离他，我们应该能保持隐匿，至少暂时是这样。

我仍然无法相信事情发生得那样。我知道雷穆斯只是在保护我们，但我仍觉得不对劲。

2雨之手月
我们建了个监狱留着雷穆斯，以防他无法控制冲动。幸运的是我们还没用过，但如果他再次变身，可以避免我们头炮。

至少事情已经平静下来，时间足够我们开始得到真正的休息。尽管如此，我们必须在夜间进行捕猎和采集，以避免惊扰那位老人。罗慕尔声称他自己用两腿追赶了只鹿，虽然我对此没有多大兴趣，但其他人说这是相当了不起的壮举。

</font>

string: 你！过来，坐下！

original: The mercenary, you spoke with him?
string: 那名雇佣兵，你跟他说过话吗？

original: Tread carefully when in his presence, I've heard he is... difficult.
string: 在他面前小心行事，听说他很难对付。

original: Clavicus knows we are on his trail. We have his attention.
string: 克拉维库斯知道我们在追踪他。我们引起了他的注意。

original: I do not know what awaits you in that cabin. Proceed with caution.
string: 我不知道那间小屋里会有什么等待着你。请小心前行。

original: The veteran, how did you fare with him?
string: 老兵，你和他相处得如何？

original: Look at you, again we meet!
string: 看着你，我们又见面了！

original: I'm certain you weren't expecting me!
string: 我敢肯定你没想到会遇到我！

original: You're no fun.
string: 你真没意思。

original: I could have you... Bah, forget it.
string: 我本可以叫你……啊，算了吧。

original: A travesty is what it is.
string: 这是个大错。

original: That night at Cropsford, not one of my finest, I'll tell you that! I'm sure this'll more than make up for it.
string: 在克罗普斯福德那个晚上，并不是我最好的一夜，我告诉你！我确定这会弥补得更多。

original: By Oblivion, I'm excited!
string: 在上古卷轴里，我兴奋极了！

original: I'll be watching, don't you worry!
string: 我会保持关注，别担心！

original: You return, welcome.
string: 你回来了，欢迎。

original: Soon, I shall have my findings published.
string: 很快，我的研究成果就会发表。

original: It is your responsibility now. Do not let it out of your sight.
string: 现在这是你的责任。不要让它离开你的视线。

original: Vile knows I am here, he will stop at nothing to torment me further.
string: 维尔知道我在这里，他将不遗余力地折磨我。

original: I thank you for all you have done.
string: 感谢你所做的一切。

original: You again. I fear this may be the last time we speak.
string: 你又来了。我担心这可能是我们最后一次交谈。

original: Soon I shall make my departure.
string: 我将很快离开。

original: I am certain Vile shall follow me, I cannot escape him.
string: 我确信维尔会跟随着我，我无法摆脱他。

original: Thank you, once again.
string: 再次感谢你。

original: The look on his face! Oh, to die for!
string: 他脸上的表情！为之倾倒！

original: Leave me alone!
string: 别管我！

original: Why! Why?!
string: 为什么会这样！为什么？

original: Get away!
string: 滚开！

original: Leave me alone!
string: 别管我！

original: Mama...
string: 妈妈……

original: Leave me you incessant demon, you shan't... Who are you?! What do you want?
string: 离我远点，你这个讨厌的恶魔，你不能...你是谁？你要什么？

original: I shan't apologise for my caution, such... lengths must be taken these days.
string: 我不会为我的谨慎道歉，这些措施必须在今天采取。

original: What else do you need?
string: 你还需要什么？

original: Act with haste, I do not know of what befell Starlight Farm.
string: 行动要迅速，我不知道星光农场发生了什么。

original: Please, investigate the farm at once.
string: 请立即调查农场。

original: We can speak another time.
string: 我们可以另作安排。

original: Each land knows to not deal with Clavicus Vile and yet...
string: 每个国家都知道不要与克拉维库斯·维尔打交道，但是……

original: I'm <Alias=Player>, I was just walking by and found you.
string: 我是<Alias=Player>，我只是路过发现了你。

original: Do you take me for a fool? You were sent by Him, weren't you?!
string: 你以为我是白痴吗？你是被派遣来的，不是吗？！

original: I won't give you what you want, leave me be!
string: 我不会给你想要的，离我远点！

original: Calm down. I don't know what you're talking about.
string: 冷静下来。我不知道你在说什么。

original: Truly?
string: 真的吗？

original: You feign ignorance, you wish to capitalise on my folly!
string: 你假装无知，想要利用我的愚蠢！

original: Begone, I shall not fall victim to your tricks!
string: 离开，我不会成为你把戏的受害者！

original: Fine, I'll go.
string: 好的，我会走了。

original: Perhaps you are not who I fear.
string: 也许你不是我害怕的那个人。

original: [Locks being undone]
string: [锁被解开的声音]

original: Come inside.
string: 进来吧。

original: Who do you think I am? I don't understand.
string: 你认为我是谁？我不明白。

original: Too damned persistent you are!
string: 你太死缠烂打了！

original: Leave this place!
string: 离开这里！

original: I'm not whoever you think I am. Us meeting was a coincidence. (Persuade)
string: 我不是你以为的那个人。我们的相遇是巧合。（劝说）

original: Still you persist?
string: 你还在坚持吗?

original: Perhaps you are not who I fear.
string: 也许你不是我害怕的那个人。

original: [Locks being undone]
string: [锁被解开的声音]

original: Come inside.
string: 进来吧。

original: No words you speak shall dissolve my will. Leave me be!
string: 你说什么也不会动摇我的意志。离我远点！

original: Who are you?
string: 你是谁？

original: Calithar, a scholar of the being I am so afeared of, an irony not lost on me.
string: 卡利萨，一位我如此害怕的存在的学者，这讽刺之处让我不禁感叹。

original: You see, I strive for knowledge on a being all others shy away from. A cosmic force of inherent sadism, the Prince of Deals himself.
string: 你看，我追求的是关于一个所有人都躲避的存在的知识。一个天生带有虐待倾向的宇宙力量，交易之王本人。

original: You're studying Clavicus Vile?
string: 你在研究克拉维库斯·维尔吗？

original: Yes, the Child-god of the Morningstar.
string: 是的，晨星之子神。

original: I have delved through countless tomes, deciphering the myriad of stories surrounding the Prince, separating fact from fiction.
string: 我深入研究了无数卷轴，解读了围绕着王子的无数故事，将事实与虚构分开。

original: I have discerned his very essence, you see.
string: 你知道，我已经辨认出了他的本质。

original: I know why he makes such bargains and the motivation that drives his involvement with mortals.
string: 我知道他为什么要进行这样的交易以及他参与凡间事务的动机。

original: I have put every recorded encounter with the Prince of Trickery to memory, I have heard all his deals.
string: 我已经记住了和欺诈王子的每一次遭遇，我听过他所有的交易。

original: So, why continue to study him?
string: 那么，为什么要继续研究他？

original: His conception, the matter of his essence interests me little. No, I seek to aid, remedy the mistakes of those who bargained with Vile.
string: 他的概念，他的本质的问题对我没什么兴趣。不，我是为了帮助，纠正与维尔交易的那些人的错误。

original: Why can't you do this yourself?
string: 为什么你自己不去做这件事呢？

original: Do you believe my presence here to be out of idleness?!
string: 你以为我在这里是闲散吗？！

original: My motivations are my own. If you do not wish to be a part of this, leave.
string: 我的动机是我的。如果你不想参与这个，就离开。

original: I see. Can I help you?
string: 明白了。我能帮你什么？

original: Mere compassion drives you? That, I did not anticipate.
string: 仅凭同情心驱使你？这，我没有预料到。

original: If you mean to uphold your word, I shan't let you do so empty handed.
string: 如果你打算遵守你的诺言，我不会让你空手而归。

original: You'll earn a hefty bag of septims for each case you investigate, does that sound fair?
string: 你将因每个案件的调查赚取一大袋子债主，这听起来合理吗？

original: If I help you, what do I get?
string: 如果我帮助你，我会得到什么？

original: Do not fret, I did not expect mere compassion to drive you.
string: 不要担心，我并不指望单纯的同情会驱使你去做。

original: I know what you want. A hefty bag of septims shall await your arrival when you return.
string: 我知道你想要什么。当你回来时，一大袋子债主将等待你。

original: Is that acceptable?
string: 这样可以吗？

original: I'm sorry, I can't do this.
string: 对不起，我办不到这一点。

original: So be it, I shan't coerce you into cooperation.
string: 既然如此，我不会强迫你合作。

original: Return when you have the stomach for this job.
string: 当你准备好接受这份工作时再回来。

original: I've bargained with Vile in the past, I have one of his artifacts.
string: 我之前曾与维尔交易过，我有他的一件神器。

original: And yet you walk away unscathed.
string: 但你却安然无恙地走了。

original: The lucky may survive his bargains but to gain an artifact? I'm unsure if you know the gravity of that fact.
string: 幸运的人也许会在他的交易中幸存，但要得到一件神器吗？我不确定你是否理解这一事实的重要性。

original: Tell me of your account, please.
string: 请告诉我你的经历。

original: I found Barbas and we spoke with Vile. We needed to retrieve the Rueful Axe.
string: 我找到了巴巴斯，和维尔交谈了。我们需要取回忧郁之斧。

original: You spoke with Barbas? Fascinating.
string: 你和巴巴斯说话了？有趣。

original: Despite his friendly appearance, that dog is no better than Vile himself. He is unwavering in his loyalty and will do anything to appease him.
string: 尽管他友好的外表，但是那只狗跟维尔本人没什么两样。他对他的忠诚坚定不移，会不惜一切取悦他。

original: He shares a great portion of the Prince's power, you are lucky to have walked away unscathed.
string: 他掌握了一部分王子的力量，你很幸运能毫发无损地离开。

original: Vile bid me to kill Barbas in exchange for the axe.
string: 邪佞指使我杀死巴巴斯来换取那把斧头。

original: You killed Barbas? That is... concerning.
string: 你杀了巴巴斯？那是……令人担忧的。

original: While his death may not be final, the dog is a source of great entertainment for the lord. Without him, the Prince may grow increasingly bored.
string: 虽然他的死亡可能并非最终结局，但这只狗却是主人的一大娱乐源泉。没有了它，王子可能会越发感到无聊。

original: I hope you know the consequences of that fact.
string: 我希望你知道这个事实的后果。

original: Vile asked me to kill Barbas. I declined and gained his Masque.
string: 维尔让我杀巴巴斯。我拒绝了并获得了他的面具。

original: Your refusal to kill the dog is more comforting than you may ever know.
string: 你拒绝杀狗的决定比你所知道的更令人安心。

original: Barbas is a source of great entertainment for the lord. His temporary death may have proved cataclysmic for countless lives.
string: 巴巴斯为主人带来了极大的娱乐。他的暂时性死亡可能会对无数生命造成灾难。

original: Now, I shall not shame you for the use of the Masque, I have endlessly studied its power, I know its allure.
string: 现在，我不会因为使用面具而羞辱你，我已经无尽地研究了它的力量，我知道它的诱惑。

original: I will only instill a warning within you. Beware its power and do not trust the Prince of Bargains.
string: 我只会在你内心灌输一则警告。小心它的力量，不要相信交易之王。

original: Before I leave, what can you tell me about Clavicus Vile?
string: 在离开之前，你能告诉我关于克拉维库斯·维尔的事情吗？

original: He is an enigmatic figure, one that has appeared in every culture since the dawn of time.
string: 他是一个神秘的人物，自时间开始以来已出现在每个文化中。

original: In each depiction he is accompanied by his loyal hound, Barbas.
string: 在每幅画作中，他都有忠诚的猎犬巴巴斯相伴。

original: Despite his often unassuming appearance, Barbas is no better than Vile himself.
string: 尽管他看起来常常不起眼，但巴巴斯和维尔本身没什么两样。

original: Tell me more about Barbas.
string: 告诉我更多关于巴巴斯的事情。

original: The dog shares a near equal power to the Prince and has aided him in fulfilling his barbaric deals.
string: 这只狗和交易之王拥有几乎同等的力量，并协助他完成他的野蛮交易。

original: Barbas is not a figure to trifle with. No matter what he says, he is a fragment of Vile, and will always work to aid him in the end.
string: 巴巴斯可不是好惹的人物。不管他说了什么，他都是邪恶的一部分，最终总会帮助他。

original: Sure, who should I see first?
string: 当然，我应该先去找谁呢？

original: I've been told of a certain tragedy that hit Starlight Farm.
string: 我听说了一起发生在星光农场的悲剧。

original: If these rumours are to be believed, Vile may have had a hand in what befell the family.
string: 如果这些谣言是真的，维尔可能与家族所遭遇的事件有关。

original: Uncover what happened there, attempt to aid those that still live and you shall have your coin.
string: 查明那里发生了什么，试图帮助那些仍然活着的人，你将得到你的金币。

original: Why would Clavicus Vile split his power evenly?
string: 为什么克拉维库斯·维尔要将他的力量平均分配？

original: Boredom.
string: 无聊。

original: Daedrologists believe the sole reason for the hound's existence to be for companionship.
string: 迪德拉学者相信，猎犬存在的唯一理由是为了陪伴。

original: The Prince is an inherently social being, he craves entertainment of all kinds.
string: 王子天生是一个社交性强的存在，他渴望各种类型的娱乐。

original: To live solitary, without another is unthinkable and so he created Barbas to endlessly bicker and argue with.
string: 要独自生活，没有另一个是不可想象的，所以他创造了巴巴斯，让他们无休止地争吵和争论。

original: I see, thank you.
string: 我明白了，谢谢。

original: This task I have taken on, laborious it may be, but I shall sift through its endless contents.
string: 这项任务我已接受，或许会很艰巨，但我将详尽地筛选其中无尽的内容。

original: No matter the cost.
string: 不惜一切代价。

original: I'll go investigate the farm.
string: 我将去调查那个农场。

original: So be it. I wish you luck.
string: 那就这样。祝你好运。

original: I found tattered pieces of a journal, could you piece it together?
string: 我发现了一个残破的日记碎片，你能拼接起来吗？

original: I thank you.
string: 谢谢你。

original: Your payment, I hope it proves worth it.
string: 你的报酬，希望它值得。

original: Are you the owner of this farm?
string: 你是这个农场的主人吗？

original: I didn't know, oh, I'm sorry. You always said I was daft. Oh I'm sorry!
string: 我不知道，哦，对不起。你总说我蠢。呃，对不起！

original: Hello? Do you own the farm?
string: 喂？你是这个农场的主人吗？

original: What's it matter?
string: 有什么问题吗?

original: I was hired to find out what happened at your farm.
string: 我被雇佣去调查发生在你农场的事情。

original: Nine save me, my poor Halva! She didn't deserve any of this!
string: 九神保佑，可怜的哈尔瓦！她什么都不应该遭受！

original: So young, so beautiful...
string: 如此年轻，如此美丽……

original: Could you tell me what happened?
string: 你能告诉我发生了什么吗？

original: She's... oh I should've been more careful!
string: 她…哦，我应该更加小心！

original: Lying there...
string: 躺在那里...

original: Nine protect me!
string: 九圣灵保佑我！

original: I'm fed up with your antics. Tell me what happened, now. (Intimidate)
string: 你的花招让我受够了。告诉我发生了什么，现在。(恐吓)

original: Gods don't hurt me!
string: 神明，请不要伤害我！

original: The house, in there...
string: 那栋房子，里面……

original: Careful of...
string: 当心...

original: Please, be careful.
string: 请小心。

original: She's all I had, you don't understand!
string: 她是我唯一的家人，你不明白！

original: I'm sorry for your loss but you must tell me what happened. (Persuade)
string: 对于你的损失我感到抱歉，但你必须告诉我发生了什么。(说服)

original: The house, she's in there...
string: 那栋房子，她在里面...

original: Be careful, oh please be careful.
string: 小心点，拜托小心点。

original: The words... I can't...
string: 这些话......我无法……

original: I understand, I'll go see for myself.
string: 我明白，我会去亲眼看看。

original: Oh you poor thing.
string: 哦，你可怜的家伙。

original: I'm sorry...
string: 对不起……

original: I did. Can you tell me what happened to her?
string: 我已经了解了。你能告诉我发生了什么吗？

original: Listen close.
string: 仔细听。

original: You've seen me farm, all the crops dead and rotten by some blight. That's what caused it, you see.
string: 你见过我的农场，所有庄稼都被某种疫病死光腐烂。这就是导致这一切的原因，你看到了。

original: T'was harvest season and yet we had nothing to sell. Neighbours didn't like us after last year, so we went hungry.
string: 那时是收获季节，但我们没有什么可以卖的。邻居们因为去年的事不喜欢我们，所以我们挨饿了。

original: I went into the town one day, to see if anyone needed honest work done. Me and Halva used to do it when we were young, you see.
string: 有一天，我进了城镇，看看是否有人需要干实在的活。你知道的，我和哈尔瓦年轻的时候经常这样做。

original: Couldn't find naught, t'was on my return when I saw him.
string: 找了又找，直到我回来的时候才看见他。

original: Saw who?
string: 看到谁？

original: Oh, that mangy beggar!
string: 那个肮脏的乞丐！

original: Ugly as a cave troll he was! Them crooked blue eyes of his, pierced right through you, they did!
string: 他长得像个洞穴巨魔！他那双狡猾的蓝眼睛，能直直地刺穿你的心！

original: And the way he smiled when he saw me, gods! Could see each of his rotted teeth clear as day!
string: 当他看到我的时候微笑的方式，天啊！仿佛一清楚到他的烂牙！

original: (Stay silent)
string: （保持沉默）

original: At a crossroads the Beggar spoke to me. Saw me gaunt figure and asked when last I'd eaten.
string: 在十字路口上，乞丐对我说了话。看到我消瘦的身影，问我上次吃什么时候。

original: I couldn't take it, broke down sobbing in front of him.
string: 我无法承受，崩溃地在他面前哭泣起来。

original: I spoke of me farm, of the misfortune that had been following me. He sympathised, consoled me even.
string: 我谈到了我的农场，讲述了一直困扰我的不幸。他表示同情，甚至安慰了我。

original: Then he asked me that damned question, Nine curse him!
string: 然后他问了我那该死的问题，九神诅咒他！

original: What did he ask?
string: 他问了什么？

original: Nine curse him! When I get me hands on him! Watch, you watch!
string: 九该死他！等我抓住他！等着瞧，你看！

original: [Sobs]
string: [抽泣]

original: Calm down. What did the Beggar ask you?
string: 冷静点。乞丐问你什么了？

original: Asked if I wished for me and my family to never worry for food again.
string: 问我是否愿意我和我的家人再也不为食物而担忧。

original: Course I wouldn't deny that, what sane man would?
string: 当然我不否认，什么样的正常人会这么做呢？

original: Said all would be right as rain when I returned home and began to walk off.
string: 他说所有的一切都会如期而至，当我回家时，便开始走开。

original: Bastard stopped dead in his tracks and asked what me favourite food was.
string: 混蛋突然停止脚步，问我最喜欢的食物是什么。

original: Beef.
string: 牛肉。

original: Aye.
string: 好啦。

original: Mara protect me...
string: 玛拉保佑我...

original: What happened when you returned home?
string: 当你回家时发生了什么事情？

original: When I entered the cabin, t'was filled with countless slices of beef.
string: 当我进入小屋时，里面堆满了无数片牛肉。

original: Was overjoyed, couldn't believe me fortune. Wanted to tell Halva the good news.
string: 我欣喜若狂，简直不敢相信我的运气。想要告诉哈尔瓦这个好消息。

original: Waded through the mess, tried to go into me bedroom...
string: 穿过混乱，试图进入我的卧室...

original: T'was then...
string: 就在那时……

original: Stood on something solid, knew it wasn't the beef.
string: 站在坚实的东西上，知道那不是牛肉。

original: Looked down and...
string: 看下去然后……

original: I'm sorry for your loss.
string: 对你的损失我感到抱歉。

original: That bloody bastard! Why did I do it?! Why, why, why...
string: 该死的混蛋！我为什么要这样做？！为什么，为什么，为什么...

original: Halva...
string: 哈尔瓦 ...

original: Have you seen the Beggar since?
string: 你有没有见过乞丐？

original: If I had, his face would lie dead in the mud, make no mistake.
string: 如果我这样做了，他的脸就会躺在泥土中冷冷地死去，毋庸置疑。

original: What he did to me, to me poor wife...
string: 他对我，对我可怜的妻子做了什么……

original: That stone in the field, how did it get there?
string: 田间的那块石头，是怎么来的？

original: Came hurtling from the sky, landed right in me field.
string: 从天空坠落，刚好落在我的田野上。

original: Happened just a few weeks before me crops grew withered. T'was sent by that bastard, I'm sure of it!
string: 就在几周前，我的庄稼凋零了。那混蛋肯定派来的！

original: Nine curse him!
string: 九诅咒他！

original: I'll be leaving.
string: 我将离开了。

original: Stranger, I know I ask a great deal from you but I have no other choice.
string: 陌生人，我知道我向你要求了很多，但我别无选择。

original: End my life, let me live in peace with my dear Halva.
string: 结束我的生命，让我与我亲爱的哈尔瓦安息。

original: I cannot continue without her
string: 没有她我无法继续.

original: I can do that for you.
string: 我可以为你做到这点。

original: You do me a great kindness, I thank ya.
string: 你对我如此慷慨，我感谢你。

original: I can't do that for you. Try to move on with your life, start anew.
string: 我不能为你做那件事。试着继续你的生活，重新开始。

original: Aye, aye. Perhaps it's what the Divines want.
string: 是的，是的。也许这是神明想要的。

original: I'll try.
string: 我会尝试。

original: I thank ya.
string: 谢谢你。

original: I'm coming...
string: 我来了……

original: Once again...
string: 再一次……

original: Valion...
string: 瓦里恩……

original: How have you been doing?
string: 你最近好吗？

original: Buried me Halva not long ago, couldn't bear to have her rotting here.
string: 不久前埋葬了哈尔瓦，无法忍受看着她在这里腐烂。

original: I visit her everyday, let her know that I still care for her.
string: 我每天都去看她，让她知道我仍然在乎她。

original: It's you, welcome my friend.
string: 是你，欢迎我的朋友。

original: I thank ya for stopping in.
string: 感谢你过来。

original: Wasn't an easy thing, all this. You're the one I can thank though. You and the Divines.
string: 这一切并不容易，但是我要感谢你。你和神明。

original: Stop that bastard, will ya?
string: 制止那个混蛋，好吗？

original: How goes your new purpose in life?
string: 你的新生活目标进展如何？

original: I thought on your words, realised I'm not fit for nothing except worshipping the Divines.
string: 我考虑了你的话，意识到我除了崇拜神之外什么都做不了。

original: Turned this place into a temple, meager as it may be.
string: 把这个地方变成了一个寺庙，尽管规模有限。

original: It's been peaceful, that much I can say for certain.
string: 这段时间十分平静，这一点我可以确定。

original: I need to be going now. It was good seeing you.
string: 我该走了。很高兴见到你。

original: You're a kind one, I thank ya.
string: 你是个好人，我感谢你。

original: I must ask ya, the fellow that hired you, what happened to him?
string: 我必须问你，雇佣你的那位什么人，发生了什么事？

original: I'm still working with him.
string: 我现在还在和他一起工作。

original: It's honourable work, what you're doing.
string: 你所做的是光荣的工作。

original: I beg of ya, put a stop to him, don't let another be hurt by his deals.
string: 我请求你，制止他，不要让另一个人受他的伤害。

original: He's moved away but he published his research on Clavicus Vile.
string: 他搬走了，但他公开了关于克拉维库斯·维尔的研究。

original: Anything to stop that... Honourable folk, both of ya.
string: 有什么可以阻止那个……你们两位尊贵的人。

original: Divines bless your souls.
string: 神祇保佑你们的灵魂。

original: He's... he's gone.
string: 他...不见了。

original: I'm sorry for your loss, sure it wasn't an easy one to take.
string: 对你的失去感到遗憾，肯定不是一件容易接受的事。

original: Divines bless his soul. I'm sure he's in a better place now.
string: 神祇保佑他的灵魂。我相信他现在身在乐土。

original: I did. He told me of his wife's death after dealing with a beggar.
string: 我确实。他告诉我处理一个乞丐之后，他妻子的死讯。

original: What?
string: 什么？

original: Did you not hear me?
string: 你没听到我说话吗？

original: N-no... no, I heard you. I just... wasn't prepared for this.
string: 不……不，我听到你了。我只是……没有做好准备。

original: What did the farmer, whoever he was, ask of this Beggar?
string: 农民，不管他是谁，向这个乞丐讨求数过什么？

original: For his family to never go hungry again. His wife was crushed upon his return.
string: 为了他的家人再也不要挨饿。他妻子在他回来后粉碎了心。

original: By Auriel... That poor man, it shakes me to my core...
string: 天降光辉……那可怜的男人，让我震惊到了内心……

original: This... Beggar, did the man describe him? Does he look something like this?
string: 这个...乞丐，他有描述那个男人吗？他看起来是这样的吗？

original: Yes, exactly like that.
string: 是的，就像那样。

original: Auriel protect me.
string: 奥瑞尔保佑我。

original: My theories prove true, we are dealing with Clavicus Vile.
string: 我的理论被证实，我们正在与克拉维库斯·维尔打交道。

original: Weren't you sure of that already?
string: 难道你不早已确定了吗？

original: Yes, yes. Let us move on.
string: 好的，好的。让我们继续前行。

original: The information you've given me is invaluable. Please, take your reward.
string: 你给我的信息是无价的。请接受你的奖励。

original: This beggar, why does he scare you so much?
string: 这个乞丐，为什么会吓到你这么厉害呢？

original: Why must you pry into matters that are not yours? You work for me and I had expected better of you.
string: 你为什么要刨根问底不属于你的事情？你为我工作，我原本期望你更出色。

original: This is not your place.
string: 这不是你的位置。

original: Now, let us move on.
string: 现在，让我们继续前进。

original: You're certain that was Vile?
string: 你确定那是维尔?

original: He is known to take many forms, change his skin to suit his whims, an ability only higher Daedra possess.
string: 他精通变化多端，可以改变皮肤以适应他的心情，这是只有高级迪德拉才具备的能力。

original: And that wish... Yes, I'm certain of it.
string: 那个愿望……是的，我确信。

original: Why does Clavicus Vile do all this?
string: 为什么克拉维库斯·维尔这样做？

original: Like all Daedra, he is a being present from existence's first inception. He has been here since time immemorial and so he shall remain.
string: 和所有的迪德拉一样，他是存在之初就存在的。自亘古以来他一直在这里，也将永远留下。

original: Some even theorise that he is envious of the Aedra. To be so embedded within the earth, to receive so much praise...
string: 有人甚至推测他是嫉妒众神。被埋葬在大地中，接受如此多的赞美...

original: A being that thrives off worship, its absence likely causing him physical pain. To  see others receive it so effortlessly by all who walk Tamriel...
string: 一只靠着崇拜生存的存在，他的缺席可能会给他带来身体上的痛苦。看到其他人轻而易举地从天际行走的每一个人那里获得它...

original: It likely drives him mad.
string: 这可能让他发疯。

original: (Stay silent)
string: （保持沉默）

original: This craving for attention is a constant presence for the Prince. It is the sole reason he chooses to meddle with countless mortals.
string: 这种对尖锐的追求是亲王的一个持续的特点。这是他选择干预无数凡人的唯一原因。

original: He sees their lives as nothing but toys, entertainment to be used and tossed away.
string: 他将他们的生命看作无足轻重，只是用来娱乐和抛弃的玩物。

original: This has been a fact throughout all time. The earliest depictions being crude paintings and idols of a masked man and his hound.
string: 这一直是始终如一的事实。最早的描绘是有关一个戴面具的男人和他的猎犬的粗糙画作和偶像。

original: Can you tell me a story of one of Vile's deals?
string: 你能为我讲一个维尔的交易故事吗？

original: I shall tell you the tale of Avalea, a noblewoman hailing from Cyrodiil.
string: 我将告诉你阿瓦蕾的故事，一位来自塞罗迪尔的贵妇人。

original: Her mother, renowned for her beauty, adored her daughter and hired countless maids and servants to serve Avalea's every whim.
string: 她母亲以美貌著称，疼爱着女儿，雇佣了无数的侍女和仆人来满足阿瓦莉亚的一切需求。

original: Yet, one such servant grew spiteful and horrifically disfigured the young Avalea.
string: 然而，有一个仆人变得怨恨，并且恐怖地毁容了年幼的阿瓦莉雅。

original: Avalea schemed for countless years, her hatred and bitterness constantly growing within her.
string: 阿瓦蕾雅阴谋了无数年，她的仇恨和苦涩不断在她心中加深。

original: (Stay silent)
string: （保持沉默）

original: Eventually, she heard of the Prince of Bargains and struck a deal with him. Her prize?
string: 最终，她听说了交易之王，并与他达成了协议。她的奖励？

original: Vile's Masque.
string: 维尔的假面。

original: While it did not fix her face, she gained the love and adoration from all who gazed upon her.
string: 虽然这并没有修复她的脸，但她却得到了所有注视她的人的爱和崇拜。

original: A year and a day after her marriage with a local baron, Vile reclaimed the Masque.
string: 结婚一年零一天后，维尔夺回了面具。

original: Avalea, despite being pregnant with the baron's child, was cast out from her home.
string: 即使怀有男爵孩子，阿瓦蕾亚也被赶出了家门。

original: What happened to Avalea?
string: 阿瓦莉娅发生了什么事？

original: Twenty-one years and a day later, Avalea's child returned to the baron's home and murdered him.
string: 二十一年后的一天，阿瓦莱娅的孩子回到男爵的家并谋杀了他。

original: An interesting story.
string: 一个有趣的故事。

original: This is the Prince of Bargains cruelty. He shall grant your every wish yet take far more in return.
string: 这就是交易王子的残忍。他会满足你的每一个愿望，但会索要更多。

original: Upon your next return, if it is your wish, I shall share another with you.
string: 在你下次回来时，如果你愿意的话，我将再给你分享另一个。

original: Who will I be seeing next?
string: 接下来我会见到谁？

original: I have heard rumours of a mercenary that was seen rising from the dead, not as a thrall or zombie. But as a man.
string: 我听说有传闻说有一名雇佣兵死而复生，不是作为奴仆或僵尸，而是作为一个人。

original: Resurrection without a price... I am certain of Vile's involvement.
string: 重生无需付出代价……我确信是瓦尔涉及。

original: He is said to be resting at Moorside Inn in Morthal. Speak with him and learn all you can.
string: 据说他正在墨索尔的坞边旅店休息。与他交谈并了解一切。

original: I'll get going then.
string: 那我就走了。

original: Do not attempt to battle this man, I do not believe it would end well.
string: 不要试图与这个人战斗，我不相信结果会好。

original: I'm <Alias=Player>, have you recently spoken with a beggar?
string: 我是<Alias=Player>，你最近与一个乞丐交谈过吗？

original: How do you know him? Don't try to lie to me, please.
string: 你怎么认识他的？请不要对我撒谎。

original: I'm to help those who dealt with the Beggar and learn about the deals.
string: 我来帮助那些与乞丐打交道并了解交易的人。

original: [Sigh] There's no helping me, not now, not ever. My fate is sealed.
string: 【叹气】没有人能帮助我，现在不行，永远不行。我的命运已经注定。

original: Could you at least try to help others who have been affected?
string: 你能至少试着帮助其他受影响的人吗？

original: No one should...
string: 没有人应该……

original: Ah, forget it.
string: 啊，算了吧。

original: I can't do much but perhaps my story will help you. Listen.
string: 我做不了什么，但也许我的故事会对你有所帮助。听着。

original: (Stay silent)
string: （保持沉默）

original: You have eyes, you know what I am.
string: 你有眼睛，你知道我是谁。

original: A mercenary, a blade for hire. Death incarnate.
string: 一个佣兵，一把随时可雇的刀。死亡的化身。

original: Well, this job was to be the end of me, you see.
string: 唉，这份工作几乎要了我的命，你明白吗。

original: I took a contract on some deserters of the Stormcloaks, needed to clear their den out and return to Windhelm.
string: 我接了一份关于风暴披风逃兵的合同，需要清理他们的巢穴并返回风暴城。

original: Bastards shot me right in my leg, severed something important. Was gushing blood but managed to crawl to a nearby crossroads.
string: 混蛋们正好朝我的腿开枪，切断了重要的东西。鲜血涌出，但我设法爬到了附近的十字路口。

original: I knew I was gonna die, accepted it even. Hard not to when lying in a puddle of your own blood.
string: 我知道我将会死，甚至接受了它。当躺在一滩自己的血中时，很难不去想。

original: Then you met the Beggar?
string: 然后你遇见了乞丐？

original: Met is a strong word. He sensed me, like a bird to carrion.
string: 相遇是一个强烈的词。他感知到了我，就像鸟儿闻到腐肉一样。

original: He was... no.
string: 他曾经……不不。

original: He spoke to me, tried to evoke some sort of empathy, if he was even capable of that.
string: 他对我说话，试图唤起某种共鸣，如果他真的有这种能力的话。

original: He said that if I wished it, I'd survive this wound and all others that I'd come to sustain.
string: 他说，如果我愿意的话，我会活下这一刀，以及所有我即将遭受的创伤。

original: I was desperate... I don't think you understand the terror of death. The dread that fills you from head to toe.
string: 我曾经绝望……我想你无法理解死亡的恐惧。充斥全身的惊慌。

original: Makes you cry out to your mother, makes you beg to return to the nights of warmth as a child.
string: 让你呼喊妈妈，让你乞求回到童年温暖的夜晚。

original: So I took it, accepted his bargain.
string: 所以我接受了，接受了他的交易。

original: And?
string: 然后呢？

original: I died.
string: 我死了。

original: (Stay silent)
string: （保持沉默）

original: I'm sure you'll have heard stories of those returning from death. Speaking of the horrors of Oblivion they saw.
string: 我相信你一定听说过那些从死亡中归来的故事。讲述他们看到的混乱的深渊之恐怖。

original: Not me.
string: 不是我。

original: I saw Tamriel, be it as it stands or centuries in the future. And I was there, endlessly walking.
string: 我看到了泰姆瑞尔，无论是它现在的状态还是未来的几个世纪。而我就在那里，无尽地徜徉。

original: No unspeakable terror plagued me. Just this land and myself, for eternity.
string: 并没有什么令人难以言喻的恐怖困扰我。只是这片土地和我自己，永远。

original: Then...
string: 那么...

original: You returned from the dead?
string: 你从死里复活了？

original: I didn't return. I was dragged back.
string: 我没有回来，是被拖回去的。

original: I awoke and my leg was healed but something was missing.
string: 我醒来时，我的腿已经愈合，但有些东西不见了。

original: I could feel it within me, a hole in my humanity.
string: 我能感觉到我内心的空洞。

original: The intensity of my emotions had dimmed. The world itself became more mundane.
string: 我的情绪变得淡了。世界本身变得更加平凡。

original: I was not me.
string: 那个不是我。

original: That's awful, I'm sorry.
string: 那真是糟透了，我很抱歉。

original: Don't apologise, there's no sense to it.
string: 不要道歉，没有意义。

original: My actions were my own, I could have refused the bargain but I didn't.
string: 我的行动是我自己的，我本可以拒绝这笔交易的，但我没有。

original: Now, I will endlessly walk these lands. Doomed to never know death.
string: 现在，我将无休止地走遍这片土地。注定永远不会得到死亡。

original: Punishment for my crimes I suppose.
string: 我猜这是我罪行的惩罚。

original: What do you mean?
string: 你是什么意思？

original: It is as I said. I am death incarnate.
string: 就如我所说。我就是死亡化身。

original: The innocents I have killed, the horrific deeds I have committed, the lives I have taken.
string: 我所杀害的无辜者，我所做的可怕之事，我所夺走的生命。

original: This is my sentence. To lose my compassion, my humanity.
string: 这就是我的判决。失去我的怜悯，我的人性。

original: Then, all I am fit for is... more death.
string: 然后，我所适合的就是...更多的死亡。

original: If you were being punished, shouldn't there be a release somewhere?
string: 如果你正在受惩罚，难道不该有一种解脱的地方吗？

original: Hmph.
string: 哼。

original: Perhaps others deserve that luxury but not me.
string: 也许其他人值得那种奢侈，但不包括我。

original: All of this... That is what I go to Oblivion for.
string: 这一切……这就是我去无尽之地的原因。

original: How many times have you died since?
string: 你死了多少次？

original: Seven.
string: 七。

original: Each time I died, I dreamt of the same vision.
string: 每次我死去，我都做着同样的梦。

original: Tamriel, myself. Nothing changes.
string: 泰姆瑞尔，我自己。什么都不会改变。

original: Then I was dragged back. Less of a man than before, a piece of me missing.
string: 然后，我被拉了回来。比以前还少一点男子气概，有一部分缺失。

original: The cost of my return.
string: 我的回归的代价。

original: (Stay silent)
string: （保持沉默）

original: I had a wife and a child, once.
string: 我曾有妻子和孩子。

original: Each time I was dragged back, I cared less for them.
string: 每次我被拖回去，我对他们的关心就少了些。

original: I wanted to love them, tried desperately to return to our normal lives.
string: 我想要爱他们，拼命地想要回到我们的正常生活中。

original: The memories were there but... the love I held for them was gone.
string: 回忆还在，但是……我对它们的爱已经消失了。

original: My daughter's smile, my wife's laugh. I didn't, couldn't care for them.
string: 我的女儿的微笑，我妻子的笑声。我并没有，也不能照顾她们。

original: And? What happened?
string: 然后呢？发生了什么？

original: I couldn't maintain a facade, attempt to live a life I did not truly feel.
string: 我无法保持伪装，试图过着我并不真正感受到的生活。

original: No, I took the coward's way out.
string: 不，我选择了懦弱的方式。

original: I abandoned them. Left them alone in the night, haven't returned since.
string: 我抛弃了他们。让他们独自一人待在夜晚，自那之后就再也没有回去过。

original: (Stay silent)
string: （保持沉默）

original: Lucia, my daughter and my wife, they're in Whiterun.
string: 露西亚，我的女儿和我的妻子，他们在白漫。

original: Would you take this to them? I can't...
string: 你能把这个给他们吗？我做不到……

original: It's not me anymore.
string: 这不再是我了。

original: No. You abandoned your family, give it to them yourself.
string: 不。你抛弃了家庭，自己给他们。

original: [Sigh]
string: [叹气]

original: Leave.
string: 离开

original: I can do that for you.
string: 我可以为你做到这点。

original: Thank you, I understand it won't be an easy thing to do.
string: 谢谢，我知道这不会是件容易的事。

original: But they deserve this much at least.
string: 但是他们至少应得到这么多。

original: I'm looking for your mother. Where can I find her?
string: 我在找你的母亲。我可以在哪里找到她？

original: [Sigh]
string: [叹气]

original: Mama died, and now I'm... I'm all alone...
string: 妈妈死了，现在……只剩我一个了……

original: I wound up here, but... I... I don't know what to do.
string: 我最终来到了这里，但是...我...不知道该怎么做。

original: I'm sorry, that must have been hard for you.
string: 抱歉，那对你一定很难。

original: Mama...
string: 妈妈……

original: I miss her so much...
string: 我好想她…

original: Your father is alive but won't see you. He wanted you to have this.
string: 你的父亲还活着，但不会见你。他希望你拿着这个。

original: What? Where is papa?!
string: 什么？爸爸去哪了？

original: Why... Why did he do that?!
string: 为什么……他为什么要那样做？！

original: You're mean. I hate you. I hate you forever and ever and ever.
string: 你真小气。我恨你。我会永远永远记恨你的。

original: Your father died in a battle. I found this note meant for you.
string: 你父亲在战斗中去世了。我发现了这封写给你的便条。

original: I'm all alone...
string: 我孤身一人……

original: I hate it here! I... I wanna go home.
string: 我讨厌这里！我...我想回家。

original: I have.
string: 我听说过。

original: How are they?
string: 他们怎么样？

original: Only Lucia, your daughter was there. She told me your wife is dead.
string: 只有露西亚，你的女儿在那里。她告诉我你的妻子已经去世。

original: Ah...
What did you tell her?
string: 你告诉她什么了？

original: I told her that you died in a battle and handed her the letter.
string: 我告诉她你在一场战斗中丧生了，并递给她这封信。

original: That is for the best.
string: 那是最好的。

original: You did not need to do that, repair my sins.
string: 你不需要这样做，弥补我的罪过。

original: But you did.
string: 但你离开了。

original: I only wish it were true...
string: 我只希望那是真的...

original: I told her the truth. That you abandoned her and handed her your letter.
string: 我告诉了她事实。你抛弃了她，并给了她你的信。

original: I see.
string: 明白了。

original: Thank you. The truth is all I have left.
string: 谢谢。真相是我唯一剩下的。

original: Endless, endless, endless...
string: 无穷无尽，无穷无尽，无穷无尽……

original: I hope you know the cost of your anger.
string: 希望你知道你愤怒的代价。

original: I can't...
string: 我做不到……

original: This is what I went to Oblivion for...
string: 这就是我去无尽深渊的原因...

original: Who are you?
string: 你是谁？

original: Let's not speak adry, drinks on me.
string: 别让话题干涩，我请客喝酒。

original: No, I won't drink with you. I know who you are, I know what you've done.
string: 不，我不和你一起喝酒。我知道你是谁，我知道你做过什么。

original: A shame, you mortals seem to love booze more than one another.
string: 可悲啊，你们凡人似乎更热爱烈酒胜过彼此。

original: My, I'm starting to see why that is! [Laugh]
string: 天哪，我开始明白为什么了！[笑声]

original: Fine, I'll drink.
string: 好吧，我会喝的。

original: Good, good!
string: 好，好！

original: Think of it as a gesture of good faith, a humble gift from me.
string: 把它看作是善意的一种表示，是我对你谦虚的礼物。

original: Why are you here?
string: 你为什么会在这里？

original: Don't be afraid, no, there's no reason to worry! I'm just... checking in, I wanted to see what you'd be up to!
string: 别害怕，不，没什么好担心的！我只是......来看看，想知道你在忙什么！

original: And my, you're doing a wonderful job, really! You've been a joy to watch, you and your little friend.
string: 哎呀，你真是做得太棒了！你和你的小伙伴太让人愉悦了。

original: Not something you often see these days, acts of pure compassion and honour, it's beautiful!
string: 这些天很少见到纯粹的同情与荣耀之举，太美丽了！

original: That's why I won't try to stop your advances. In fact, I hope to see it continue!
string: 这就是为什么我不会阻止你的进展。事实上，我希望看到它继续下去！

original: Ulfgar, you did that to him?
string: 乌尔夫加，是你对他做的吗？

original: Hmm... Who's to say really?
string: 嗯...谁说得准呢？

original: A gust of wind could prove the downfall of an empire, a few words spoken... Simple causation and effect!
string: 一阵风可能导致帝国的衰落，几句话说出...就是简单的因果关系！

original: You're disgusting. I'm leaving.
string: 你真让人恶心。我走了。

original: Go tell your little friend about me, please. I'm sure he'd love to hear all about it!
string: 去告诉你的小伙伴关于我，请。我肯定他会很乐意听到这一切！

original: Oh, one thing. Your next job, I think... Ah, nevermind. You'll figure it out soon enough. [Laugh]
string: 哦，对了。你的下一个工作，我的想法是……啊，算了。你很快就会明白。【笑声】

original: I'll be going. Farewell.
string: 我将离开。再见。

original: You've been so kind, I think you deserve a reward!
string: 你一向如此友善，我觉得你应得到奖赏！

original: I think I'll let you in on a little secret.
string: 我觉得我要告诉你一个小秘密。

original: Your next job, I think... Ah, nevermind. You'll figure it out soon enough! [Laugh]
string: 你接下来的任务，我想……啊，算了。你很快会明白的！[笑]

original: Yes. He's cursed with immortality. Everytime he dies, he loses a part of himself
string: 是的。他被诅咒拥有永生。每次他死去，他就会失去一部分自己。

original: To live without an end... To watch your loved ones wither and grow old while you remain?
string: 活着没有尽头……看着你所爱的人衰老，而你仍年轻？

original: A horrific fate, even for a man of his occupation.
string: 对于他这个职业来说，这是一个可怕的命运。

original: Did he mention the Beggar? What did he reveal?
string: 他有提到那个乞丐吗？他透露了什么？

original: A similar situation. He was dying and the Beggar said he'd be immortal.
string: 一个类似的情况。他垂死之际，乞丐说他会长生不老。

original: Another of Vile's deals... We are on his trail, that is for certain.
string: 又一个维尔的交易...我们在追踪他，这是肯定的。

original: His immortality, likely a curse he shall bear till the end of this world... Horrific.
string: 他的不朽，可能是一个诅咒，他将负担到这个世界的末日... 可怕。

original: Did he ask for anything, a favour perhaps?
string: 他有没有问你要什么，或许一个请求？

original: He did. I brought a letter to his daughter that he abandoned.
string: 他有。我送了一封信给他抛弃的女儿。

original: By Auriel... Family. The things that hold us together.
string: 天降光辉……家庭。将我们紧密联系在一起的事物。

original: You may judge him but I know well his feeling of abandonment. A shame and a guilt that...
string: 你可能会评判他，但我很清楚他被遗弃的感觉。一种遗憾和罪恶……

original: He asked me to bring a letter to his daughter that he abandoned. I didn't do it.
string: 他让我把一封信带给他遗弃的女儿。我没有这样做。

original: Judge him all you want but that man is cursed to endless life. When you grow old and die, he shall still live, walking this plane.
string: 尽管你对他做出判断，但那个人注定要永生。当你变老并死去时，他依然会活着，在这个位面漫步。

original: An eternity of unrest? One letter seems so insignificant. The least you could have done was grant that wish.
string: 永世的不安？一封信似乎微不足道。你至少能做的就是满足那个愿望。

original: For that feeling of abandonment... It is one I know too well.
string: 那种被遗弃的感觉...我太了解了。

original: Who did you abandon?
string: 你抛弃了谁？

original: Circumstances beyond me forced my departure, it was not a voluntary act.
string: 我离开是被迫的情况所迫，不是自愿的行为。

original: We must move on from this.
string: 我们必须继续前行。

original: Your payment. Likely a small solace after what you've dealt with. I hope it proves worth it.
string: 你的报酬。经历过的一切后，这只是微不足道的慰藉。希望它值得。

original: I believe I spoke with the Beggar. He was friendly and mentioned our next job.
string: 我想我和那个乞丐交谈过。他很友好，提到了我们下一项任务。

original: Auriel save me.
string: 奥瑞尔救救我。

original: He is a conniving being, his charismatic demeanour is nothing more than a facade. A lure into deep waters, where his cunning shall drown you.
string: 他是一个狡诈的存在，他的魅力外表不过是一具幌子。引人深渊，他的狡猾将淹没你。

original: This front he puts on, it is a good thing. It means you do not lie dead in that tavern, Vile likely takes enjoyment out of our cause.
string: 他表面上的东西是好的。这意味着你并没有躺在那家酒馆里，维尔可能从我们的事中感受到乐趣。

original: But... that does mean he is aware of our presence...
string: 但是...这意味着他知道我们的存在...

original: Should we stop our work?
string: 我们应该停止工作吗？

original: No, of course not. We've come too far to let Vile disrupt what we do.
string: 不，当然不能。我们已经走了太远，不能让维尔破坏我们的计划。

original: This mention of your next job, you must act with supreme caution. I do not know what he may have planned but I'm certain it shall be dangerous.
string: 提及你下一份工作时，务必小心谨慎。我不知道他可能计划了什么，但我肯定会很危险。

original: I'd like to know more about you.
string: 我想了解更多关于你的事情。

original: A fragment, to appease your curiosity.
string: 一片碎片，以满足你的好奇心。

original: My disdain for hired arms is not one born of class but instead a direct relation. I myself once numbered amongst their ranks.
string: 我对雇佣武装的鄙视并非出于阶级之分，而是一种直接联系。我曾经也是他们中的一员。

original: The Undaunted we dubbed ourselves. We were youthful but eager for all the job held.
string: 我们以不屈不挠自居。我们年轻而充满对一切工作的渴望。

original: What did you do in the band?
string: 你在做什么？

original: Taking a life was not something I was accustomed to. I preferred the art of Restoration, tending to the wounded.
string: 夺取生命不是我习惯的事。我更喜欢治愈术，照顾受伤者。

original: I needed not bloody my hands with the lives of our bounty and still I would make a fair wage.
string: 我无需亲手流血杀死我们赏金的人，仍可得到合理的报酬。

original: It was a deal I enjoyed for a time, though I would soon grow dissatisfied with my role.
string: 一度，我很喜欢这个交易，尽管我很快会对我的角色感到不满。

original: How come?
string: 怎么会这样呢？

original: Years of bloodshed will... wear on you, create a conflict within your mind.
string: 多年的流血……会消磨你，制造你内心的矛盾。

original: I am not a man of violence, nor was I ever and so I grew to despise my time with the Undaunted.
string: 我不是一个暴力的人，也从未如此，所以我恨透了我和无畏者共度的时光。

original: We eventually took a contract on a particularly violent soldier, one who had committed unspeakable crimes to a family.
string: 我们最终接下了一名尤为暴戾的士兵的合同，这名士兵对一个家庭犯下了不可言喻的罪行。

original: (Stay silent)
string: （保持沉默）

original: Upon his death, we learned that this soldier was much more than that. He was in fact a high ranking official of the Dominion.
string: 在他去世后，我们了解到这名士兵不仅仅是一名士兵。他实际上是多米尼安的一名高级官员。

original: I knew the danger we were in, murder of a government official is not a crime taken lightly in Alinor.
string: 我知道我们面临的危险，暗杀政府官员在阿林诺可是一件严重的罪行。

original: And so, I left the Undaunted and got on the quickest boat to Cyrodiil.
string: 于是，我离开了无畏者，登上了前往塞琉迪尔的最快船只。

original: Just like that you abandoned them? Where's your loyalty?
string: 就这样你就抛弃他们了？你的忠诚在哪里？

original: I won't be shamed for my actions. My life was worth more than lying dead in a ditch.
string: 我不会为我的行为感到羞耻。我的生命不值得死在沟渠里。

original: My departure was my only chance for survival, else I'd have been cut down like a  dog.
string: 我离开是我的唯一求生机会，否则我会像只狗一样被铲除。

original: Besides, it was not an action I took lightly. I had friends in that band, friends I loved dearly.
string: 除此之外，这不是我轻易采取的行动。我在那支乐队有朋友，我非常爱他们。

original: I still wonder. When I got on that ship, did they curse my name as I sailed away?
string: 我仍在怀疑。当我登上那艘船时，他们有没有诅咒我的名字，就在我远航时……

original: Or were they cut down days before, unaware of my escape...
string: 或者在几天前就被砍倒了，他们不知道我已逃脱……

original: I see. You were smart to do that.
string: 我明白了。你做那件事很聪明。

original: Indeed, I knew my life was worth more than winding up dead in a ditch.
string: 的确，我知道我的人生价值远不止在一个沟渠里死去。

original: My departure from Alinor was my only hope for survival, else I'd be cut down like a dog.
string: 离开艾林诺是我唯一的生存希望，否则我会被像狗一样砍倒。

original: And yet... I had friends in the Undaunted, friends I loved dearly.
string: 然而……我在不屈不挠中有些爱的朋友。

original: I still wonder. When I got on that ship, did they curse my name as I sailed away?
string: 我仍在怀疑。当我登上那艘船时，他们有没有诅咒我的名字，就在我远航时……

original: Or were they cut down days before, unaware of my escape...
string: 或者在几天前就被砍倒了，他们不知道我已逃脱……

original: So how did you come to study Clavicus Vile?
string: 那你是怎么开始研究克拉维克斯维尔的？

original: Of my own will I spoke of this story, told you of my past.
string: 我主动讲述了这个故事，告诉你我的过去。

original: I won't share anymore of it, not today.
string: 我不会再分享了，今天就这样吧。

original: The Undaunted, are they who you left behind?
string: 无畏者，是你留下的人吗？

original: One of many.
string: 众多中的一员。

original: Please, let us move on.
string: 请，让我们继续前行。

original: Can you tell me another story about Clavicus Vile?
string: 你能给我讲另一个关于克拉维库斯·维尔的故事吗？

original: I shall tell you of Drugan, the Orcish bard.
string: 我将告诉你有关德鲁甘，半兽人诗人的故事。

original: As a boy, Drugan would walk the grounds of Solitude, spending hours listening and admiring the songs of the Bards College.
string: 小时候，德鲁甘会在孤独之地的地面上漫步，花几个小时倾听并赞美吟游诗人学院的歌曲。

original: He wished for nothing more than to become a bard himself, to play songs so moving every person on Tamriel would want to hear them.
string: 他最希望的就是成为一名吟游诗人，演奏动人的歌曲，让泰姆瑞尔上的每个人都想听到它们。

original: Despite his efforts as a teen, his brutish fingers could not play the fine strings of a lute and his strength was far too great for any drum.
string: 尽管他努力成为一个青少年，但他粗野的手指不能弹奏吉他的美妙音弦，而他的力量对任何鼓都远远过大。

original: So he went to Vile?
string: 那他去找维尔了吗？

original: Indeed, he asked to become a master of music and song and offered his soul in return.
string: 确实，他要求成为音乐和歌曲的大师，并提出以他的灵魂进行交换。

original: Yet Drugan had heard songs of the Prince and was wary of his antics and so he claimed one stipulation.
string: 德鲁甘曾经听说过王子的歌声，并对他的花招感到警惕，因此他提出了一个条件。

original: That his soul could only be collected in Hammerfell.
string: 他的灵魂只能在落锤那里收集。

original: Clavicus Vile, eager for entertainment, accepted.
string: 克拉维库斯·维尔，渴望娱乐，接受了。

original: (Stay silent)
string: （保持沉默）

original: For the years that followed, he was renowned across all Tamriel for the beauty of his music and tragedy of his songs.
string: 随后的几年里，他因其美妙的音乐和悲情的歌曲而声名显赫于整个泰姆瑞尔。

original: As soon he began to play, patrons who scoffed at his bullish figure were moved to tears.
string: 一他开始演奏，那些嘲笑他粗鲁外表的客人们都被感动得流下了眼泪。

original: Yet this fame would also be the death of him.
string: 然而，这种名声最终也将是他的死亡。

original: How so?
string: 怎么了？

original: He agreed to play for a new inn that had opened up in Cyrodiil. In his haste, he did not consider the gravity of the inn's name.
string: 他同意为在锡瓦迪尔开设的一家新客栈演奏。在匆忙中，他没有考虑到客栈名字的严肃性。

original: Hammerfell.
string: 落锤。

original: When he struck the final note, his lute dropped to the ground and his body turned to ash.
string: 当他弹奏最后一声时，他的琉特掉落在地上，他的身体变成了灰烬。

original: A single cord echoed through the room, one of melancholy.
string: 一根单独的琴弦在房间里回荡，悲伤。

original: I see, a poor way to go.
string: 我明白了，走上这条不幸的道路。

original: Indeed, his soul is damned to work for the Prince for eternity, with no hope of release.
string: 的确，他的灵魂被宣判为永远为那位王子效劳，没有任何希望得以解脱。

original: What Drugan is subjected to... I don't wish to know.
string: 德鲁甘遭受到的……我不想知道。

original: I don't see the point in helping these people. We can't cure them.
string: 我不明白帮助这些人有什么意义。我们不能治愈他们。

original: Would you deny a dying man a visit from a loved one? Our work may not heal their ailments but it can put them at peace.
string: 你会拒绝一个垂死之人见一见他的亲人吗？我们的工作可能治不好他们的疾病，但可以让他们心安。

original: That is a luxury countless would die for.
string: 这是许多人会为之而死的奢侈。

original: Who should I see next?
string: 接下来应该去见谁？

original: I have heard tales of a veteran from the Great War who gained back the use of his legs.
string: 我听说有关一位从大战中失去双腿却后来恢复行动自由的老兵的传说。

original: This man is now mysteriously missing.
string: 这个人现在神秘失踪了。

original: If he did truly regain his mobility, his bargain must have been of some significance. We must decipher what became of him...
string: 如果他真的恢复了行动能力，他的交易肯定有些重要。我们必须弄清楚他的下落……

original: And the price he paid.
string: 以及他所付出的代价。

original: I see. I'll go do that now.
string: 我明白了。我现在就去做。

original: Be careful, I'm certain Vile is involved in this.
string: 小心，我肯定维尔参与其中。

original: He made a deal to walk again but I found him dead in a cave.
string: 他达成了再次行走的交易，但我在山洞里发现他已经死去。

original: Such a horrific way to go...
string: 这样可怕的离去方式……

original: I cannot do this anymore. I simply cannot.
string: 我再也不能这样做了。我真的不行。

original: What's wrong?
string: 怎么了？

original: Do you not have a heart? Are you truly so accustomed to violence?!
string: 你没有良心吗？难道你真的如此习惯暴力吗！

original: That was a man, an innocent man who was brutally murdered! For what? To wish to walk again?!
string: 那是一个人，一个无辜的人被残忍地杀害了！为了什么？为了想再次行走？！

original: He had a family... Auriel save me, he had a family...
string: 他有家庭...奥瑞尔拯救我，他有一个家庭...

original: There's more to this than his death. Tell me about it.
string: 这不仅仅是他的死亡。告诉我更多关于这件事。

original: After I had abandoned the Undaunted and fled Alinor, I settled in Cyrodiil, making Cropsford my home.
string: 在我抛弃了无畏者并逃离了艾林诺之后，我在塞尔迪德定居下来，将克罗普斯福德当作我的家。

original: They desperately needed a healer after a goblin raid struck their village. As it so happened, my expertise lay in the art of Restoration.
string: 他们在一次地精袭击后急需医治者。碰巧，我的专长正是在复原艺术方面。

original: They were distrustful at first, the Great War still eclipsed their minds. Yet I grew accustomed to the peace their distance offered.
string: 一开始他们很不信任，大战依然笼罩在他们的思绪中。然而我逐渐习惯了他们远离的平和。

original: The solitude gave me time to ponder all that had transpired with the Undaunted.
string: 孤独给了我时间考虑与不屈不挠之间发生的一切。

original: After a time, they recognised my work and the village opened their hearts to me.
string: 过了一段时间，他们认可了我的工作，村庄的人向我敞开了心扉。

original: Didn't the Thalmor wish to hunt you down?
string: 梭默不是想追捕你吗？

original: After the War, an Altmer in a small hamlet was no longer so far fetched, the villagers did not scrutinise my presence.
string: 战后，一个高精灵在一个小村庄已不再那么牵强，村民们不再质疑我的存在。

original: As for the Thalmor, I believe they hunted down all my brethren in Alinor and my face slipped from their minds.
string: 至于梦境法师，我相信他们追杀了艾琳诺的所有同胞，而我的面容已从他们的记忆中消失。

original: So why'd you leave?
string: 那你为什么离开？

original: Silence, please. These words are not ones I relish.
string: 请安静。这些话不是我乐意的。

original: Another Altmer eventually moved into the village, Thaliel.
string: 另一名高等精灵最终搬进了村子，萨里尔。

original: I was enamoured with her. Every time I saw her, my gaze was stuck to her. She was...
string: 我迷恋她。每次看到她，我的目光都离不开她。她是…

original: We soon fell in love, settled in with one another. And after a few years, we had our son, Valion.
string: 我们很快相爱，并在一起安定下来。几年后，我们有了儿子瓦利昂。

original: (Stay silent)
string: （保持沉默）

original: Not long after, a plague ravaged the town.
string: 不久之后，一场瘟疫袭击了城镇。

original: Countless of the village were infected and soon my clinic was filled with the dying and diseased.
string: 无数村庄被感染，很快我的诊所就挤满了垂死和疾病的人。

original: The lucky ones soon passed away after infection, soothed by my magic and herbs.
string: 那些幸运者在感染后很快去世，被我的魔法和草药缓和。

original: The others were bed-ridden, covered in horrific boils that none of my salves could sedate.
string: 其他人卧病在床，被可怕的疮所覆盖，我的药膏无法安抚他们。

original: They were subject to ceaseless agony.
string: 他们遭受着无尽的痛苦。

original: What was the disease?
string: 那是何种疾病？

original: To this very day, I do not know.
string: 直到今天，我也不知道。

original: It was nothing I'd ever seen before. Its efficiency, the pain that it brought to its victims...
string: 这是我从未见过的东西。它的效率，它给受害者带来的痛苦...

original: You cannot imagine the screams that I heard.
string: 你无法想象我听到的尖叫声。

original: Please, carry on.
string: 请您继续。

original: Valion soon became infected. Thaliel was inconsolable...
string: 瓦利昂很快也被感染了。萨里安伤心欲绝…

original: Every moment he was awake he was in utter agony. He would ceaselessly cry, nothing I did would soothe his pain.
string: 每当他清醒的时候都在遭受剧痛。他不停地哭泣，我做的一切都无法减轻他的痛苦。

original: One night, when he and my other patients slept, I walked to the nearby hills.
string: 有一天晚上，当他和我的其他病人睡着时，我走到了附近的小山。

original: I sought peace and solitude. An opportunity to escape the cries of pain.
string: 我寻找和平和孤独。一个逃避痛苦哭声的机会。

original: That's when I saw him.
string: 那时我看见了他。

original: The Beggar.
string: 乞丐。

original: Before my eyes locked with his, I could not hear nor see any sign of him. It was as if he had appeared out of thin air.
string: 在我的眼中与他的目光相遇之前，我既听不见也看不见他的任何迹象。就好像他从空气中出现一样。

original: He sat next to me and questioned why I was out so late.
string: 他坐在我旁边，询问我为什么这么晚才出来。

original: I spoke of my troubles, of the pain my poor son was in.
string: 我谈到了我的困扰，说到了我可怜儿子所受的痛苦。

original: He listened for a time, and then he spoke.
string: 他静静地倾听了一阵，然后开口了。

original: He said, if I wished it, all my patients would be freed from their torment.
string: 他说，如果我愿意，所有我的患者将从痛苦中得到解脱。

original: (Stay silent)
string: （保持沉默）

original: I did not know who I dealt with, I could not! I was desperate, by Auriel I was desperate!
string: 我不知道我和谁打交道，我不行！我绝望了，以奥里尔的名义，我绝望了！

original: I... I... I agreed.
string: 我...我...我同意。

original: He opened his mouth and he laughed! That bastard laughed in my face!
