string: 他开口笑了！那个混蛋当着我的面笑了！

original: My son, do you understand?! My own flesh and blood! That bastard took him away from me!
string: 我的儿子，你明白吗？！我的亲生血肉！那个混蛋把他带走了！

original: He killed him, he killed my Valion...
string: 他杀了他，他杀了我的瓦利昂……

original: I'm sorry for your loss. I can't imagine the pain.
string: 对于你的损失我感到抱歉。我无法想象那种痛苦。

original: The next morning, I returned to my clinic.
string: 第二天早上，我回到了我的诊所。

original: Dead. All of them lay dead.
string: 都死了。他们全都死了。

original: I walked over to his crib, to where my poor boy slept.
string: 我走到他的婴儿床前，我的可怜孩子睡在那里。

original: He was so small... so pale...
string: 他是如此渺小......如此苍白......

original: Calm down. What happened to your patients?
string: 冷静下来。你的病人发生了什么事？

original: Dead. All of them lay dead.
string: 都死了。他们全都死了。

original: I walked over to his crib, to where my poor boy slept.
string: 我走到他的婴儿床前，我的可怜孩子睡在那里。

original: He was so small... so pale...
string: 他是如此渺小......如此苍白......

original: (Stay silent)
string: （保持沉默）

original: Thaliel walked in as I cradled my boy.
string: 萨里尔走进来时，我正抱着我的孩子。

original: Her eyes... They were not her own. They were a stranger's.
string: 她的眼睛...不是属于她自己的。是陌生人的。

original: She could not fathom what happened. I begged her to understand, tell her that I would never harm my Valion...
string: 她无法理解发生了什么。我哀求她理解，告诉她我绝对不会伤害我的瓦利昂...

original: She wouldn't listen...
string: 她就是不肯听...

original: She told the others what I had done.
string: 她告诉其他人我做了什么。

original: They tried to kill me... They tried to kill me...
string: 他们试图杀我…… 他们试图杀我……

original: I can't fathom what you must feel, I'm so sorry.
string: 我无法想象你必须要承受的感受，我很抱歉。

original: (Silence)
string: （沉默）

original: Take your gold.
string: 拿走你的金币。

original: So that's why you study Clavicus Vile.
string: 所以你研究 克拉维库斯·维尔 就是为了这个。

original: (Silence)
string: （沉默）

original: Take your gold.
string: 拿走你的金币。

original: What do you want?!
string: 你想怎样？

original: I know our little friend has been doing a lot of talking recently. I thought we'd do the same. No strings attached. Just me and you.
string: 我知道我们的小朋友最近说了很多话。我想我们也可以这样做。毫无牵挂。只有我和你。

original: Fine, speak.
string: 好的，请说。

original: Our dear friend, so often absorbed in his research on... me. Never on himself, never on what he's lost.
string: 我们亲爱的朋友，总是如此专注于他对我这件事的研究。从不关注自己，从不关注他失去的东西。

original: Hearing about Cropsford, Thaliel, Valion, all the suffering he's endured. You could get rid of it, just like that.
string: 听说过克罗普斯福德，萨里尔，瓦利昂，他所忍受的一切痛苦。你可以摆脱它，就像那样简单。

original: I must say, looking back on it, perhaps I was too... much.
string: 我得说，回想过去，也许我太……过分了。

original: Can I leave?
string: 我可以离开吗？

original: What friend would you be to do such a thing?
string: 什么样的朋友会做出这种事来？

original: Our dear companion, so often absorbed in his research on... me. Never on himself, never on what he's lost.
string: 我们亲爱的伴侣，总是专注于他对......我的研究。从未关注自己，从未关注他失去的东西。

original: Hearing about Cropsford, Thaliel, Valien, all the suffering he's endured. You could get rid of it, just like that.
string: 听说克罗普斯福德、萨里尔、瓦利恩，他所忍受的一切。你可以消除它，就像那样简单。

original: I must say, looking back on it, perhaps I was too... much.
string: 我得说，回想过去，也许我太……过分了。

original: (Stay silent)
string: （保持沉默）

original: So, I'll offer a helping hand. A clean slate, a new start, etc. No strings attached. No messy surprises.
string: 所以，我会伸出援手。一张干净的白纸，一个新的开始等等。没有附加条件。没有烦乱的惊喜。

original: Though, I must warn you, I'm not fond of rejection. I find it so... tedious.
string: 虽然我必须警告你，我不喜欢被拒绝。我觉得那样很……令人厌烦。

original: What's the catch?
string: 有什么要注意的？

original: Have you got rocks for ears?
string: 难道你的耳朵像石头一样吗？

original: I'm a man of my word, no strings attached and no messy surprises!
string: 我言出必行，绝不留下任何限制或混乱的惊喜！

original: You're right to be skeptical but come, doesn't everyone deserve a second chance?
string: 你对持怀疑态度是正确的，但是来吧，每个人都应该有第二次机会吧？

original: Why would I do this?
string: 我为什么要这样做呢？

original: The lengths you've already gone to...
string: 你已经走了这么远 ...

original: You bloodied your hands for the sake of mercy, put an innocent man out of his suffering. I must say, not an easy thing to do.
string: 你为了怜悯而沾染了自己的手，解脱一个无辜的人的痛苦。我必须说，这不是一件容易的事。

original: You delivered that heartfelt letter to that poor orphan. An act that should have been done by another, but you carried it out.
string: 你把那份发自内心的信交给了那个可怜的孤儿。本应该由别人来完成，但你完成了。

original: You've done all this, all for the sake of your friend. Why not do him a final kindness?
string: 你做了这一切，全是为了你的朋友。为什么不为他做最后的善事呢？

original: The lengths you've already gone to...
string: 你已经走了这么远 ...

original: You bloodied your hands for the sake of mercy, put an innocent man out of his suffering. I must say, not an easy thing to do.
string: 你为了怜悯而沾染了自己的手，解脱一个无辜的人的痛苦。我必须说，这不是一件容易的事。

original: You forced responsibility on the depraved, didn't entertain his delusion. Such harsh words couldn't have come out easy.
string: 你把责任强加给了堕落者，没有接受他的妄想。这样刻薄的话语绝不会轻易流露。

original: You've done all this, all for the sake of your friend. Why not do him a final kindness?
string: 你做了这一切，全是为了你的朋友。为什么不为他做最后的善事呢？

original: The lengths you've already gone to...
string: 你已经走了这么远 ...

original: You reformed that poor old farmer, let him move on with his life and continue living. Tough words to speak.
string: 你帮助了那个可怜的老农民，让他继续生活并且继续活下去。说这些话不容易。

original: You delivered that heartfelt letter to that poor orphan. An act that should have been done by another, but you carried it out.
string: 你把那份发自内心的信交给了那个可怜的孤儿。本应该由别人来完成，但你完成了。

original: You've done all this, all for the sake of your friend. Why not do him a final kindness?
string: 你做了这一切，全是为了你的朋友。为什么不为他做最后的善事呢？

original: The lengths you've already gone to...
string: 你已经走了这么远 ...

original: You reformed that poor old farmer, let him move on with his life and continue living. Tough words to speak.
string: 你帮助了那个可怜的老农民，让他继续生活并且继续活下去。说这些话不容易。

original: You forced responsibility on the depraved, didn't entertain his delusion. Such harsh words couldn't have come out easy.
string: 你把责任强加给了堕落者，没有接受他的妄想。这样刻薄的话语绝不会轻易流露。

original: You've done all this, all for the sake of your friend. Why not do him a final kindness?
string: 你做了这一切，全是为了你的朋友。为什么不为他做最后的善事呢？

original: How will you accomplish that?
string: 你会怎样实现这一点？

original: Simple.
string: 很简单。

original: He's a fond reader, is he not? Always sticking his nose in dusty old tomes or writing his own theories on, well, me.
string: 他是一个热情的读者，不是吗？总是把鼻子捅进尘封的古老典籍中或者写自己的理论，嗯，关于我。

original: So, I made a gift just for him. His very own book.
string: 所以，我为他做了一份礼物。他自己的书。

original: All he has to do is read this and [Clicks fingers] all is well!
string: 他只需阅读这本书，[手指轻弹]一切都会好起来！

original: What do you think?
string: 你觉得呢？

original: How will it give him a new start?
string: 它将如何给他一个新的开始？

original: Full of questions, aren't we?
string: 我们有很多问题，不是吗？

original: Come, have a little faith, don't ruin the magic. [Laugh]
string: 来吧，有点信任，不要破坏这份魔力。[笑]

original: I'm never going to trust you. I won't give him that book.
string: 我永远不会相信你。我不会把那本书给他。

original: A shame, truly, a shame.
string: 真是遗憾，真是遗憾。

original: You watch someone for so long, think you've grown to know them. And they still find ways to disappoint. [Sigh]
string: 你看着一个人看了这么久，以为了解了他们。然而他们仍然会让你失望。[叹气]

original: No matter. The pieces are falling into place, just as I wanted.
string: 不要紧。碎片正按照我所期望的方式落入位置。

original: So be it. Go tell your little friend what we spoke about, I'm sure he'll love to hear it.
string: 就这样吧。去告诉你那小家伙我们谈了些什么，我相信他会很高兴听到的。

original: I can give it to him.
string: 我可以把它给他。

original: Splendid, splendid!
string: 太棒了，太棒了！

original: After all he said that day, it gives me goosebumps.
string: 那天他说完之后，我觉得浑身一阵鸡皮疙瘩。

original: But don't you worry, this'll whip things right back into shape!
string: 但是别担心，这将会把一切恢复正常！

original: I found this book on Vile, could you take a look? (Lie)
string: 我在邪恶的书上找到这本书，你能看一看吗？（谎）

original: Certainly. These past few days, I have been... adrift, my studies failing to captivate me.
string: 当然。这几天，我...迷失了方向，我的研究无法吸引我的注意力。

original: I'm sure this will...
string: 我相信这会……

original: This writing...
string: 这写的是……

original: (Silence)
string: （沉默）

original: This book, it's meant to give you a fresh start. Please, read it. (Persuade)
string: 这本书，是为了给你一个新的开始。请阅读它。（劝说）

original: You spoke with him, didn't you?! After all I have told you, still you fell for his deceit?
string: 你和他说话了，是吗？！尽管我告诉过你那么多，你还是上他的当了？

original: You dirty bastard, you know what he did to me! You've damned me!
string: 你这个肮脏的混蛋，你知道他对我做了什么！你诅咒了我！

original: The things I would do for such a thing... The sacrifices I would make for another chance. Please, hand it over.
string: 为了这件事我会做些什么...我会为了另一个机会做出牺牲。请交出它。

original: I cannot live... this writing...  I...
string: 我无法活下去...这个写的...我...

original: (Silence)
string: （沉默）

original: Calithar, are you alright?
string: 卡利萨，你还好吗？

original: Ah... ah...
What happened to you?
string: 接着发生了什么在你身上？

original: (Silence)
string: （沉默）

original: Ah...
(Step away)
string: （走开）

original: You...
The Beggar is outside your house. He wanted me to give you a book.
string: 乞丐在你家外面。他让我给你带来一本书。

original: What? What book? Do you have it?
string: 什么？什么书？你有吗？

original: I do, he said it'd give you a clean start. But, I won't give it to you.
string: 他说这会给你一个新的开始，但我不会给你。

original: You took it off him?!
string: 你从他身上拿下了吗？！

original: After all this time, still you do not heed my words?! Each tale I have told you of that monster and yet you took his offer?!
string: 这么长时间过去了，你还是不听我的话吗？！我告诉过你每一个怪物的故事，你竟然还接受了他的提议？！

original: It is no gift, it is a trap! A gateway to... Auriel knows what!
string: 这不是礼物，而是陷阱！通往……奥瑞尔知道什么地方的门！

original: Keep it tightly bound within your pack, do not touch it and do not open it. No matter what transpires, do not attempt to read it.
string: 把它紧紧地绑在你的包里，不要碰它，也不要打开它。不管发生什么，都不要试图阅读它。

original: I warn you, do not leave it unattended. If one were to read it, the consequences of such an action would fall on you, no one else.
string: 我警告过你，不要让它无人看管。如果有人阅读它，后果将由你承担，没有其他人。

original: I will, don't worry.
string: 我会的，不用担心。

original: Your intelligence baffles me but... I must thank you. For refusing to give me that thing.
string: 你的智慧让我困惑，但是...我必须感谢你。因为拒绝给我那个东西。

original: I must admit, even knowing its origins, a small portion wishes for nothing more than to see its contents.
string: 我必须承认，即使知道它的起源，也有一小部分希望看到其内容。

original: No, I don't have it but the Beggar said it would give you a clean slate.
string: 不，我没有，但乞丐说它会给你一个干净的开始。

original: How...
I must admit, even knowing its origins, the twisted humour it likely contains, a small portion wishes for nothing more than to see its contents.
string: 我必须承认，即使知道了它的起源，了解了它可能包含的扭曲幽默，也有一小部分希望能看到其内容。

original: What do you think is in it?
string: 你觉得里面是什么？

original: Whatever Clavicus told you, I am certain it will contain no such thing. In all likelihood, its contents were not meant to be read by a mortal mind.
string: 无论克拉维塔斯告诉你什么，我可以肯定里面不包含这样的东西。很可能，其内容并不适合凡人阅读。

original: It is no more than a sick joke, an allure to appeal to your sense of humanity and my desperation.
string: 这不过是一个恶作剧，一种吸引你人性和我绝望的诱惑。

original: It may rid me of my emotions, leave me nothing more than a hollow shell.
string: 这可能让我摆脱情感，只剩下一个空洞的外壳。

original: Or perhaps I would be sucked into the book, subject to Vile's sadistic whims.
string: 或许我会被吸入书中，受到邪恶者变幻莫测的痛苦权利。

original: Whatever the case, it does not matter. Vile's tricks did not work on you.
string: 不管怎样，这都不重要。维尔的把戏对你没有用。

original: How are you feeling?
string: 你感觉怎么样？

original: To be in such a state, to remember all that transpired...
string: 处于这种状态，记得所发生的一切...

original: To once again be at the whims of a Prince. I am... tired.
string: 再次被一个王子摆布。我...累了。

original: I must move on from our work, direct my focus to a different effort. One of preventative action.
string: 我必须继续我们的工作，将我的注意力转移到不同的努力上。预防行动之一。

original: How will you do that?
string: 你会怎么办？

original: Publish my research, let each Man and Mer know of Clavicus Vile's being and the misery he inflicts.
string: 发布我的研究，让每一个人都知道克拉维库斯·维尔的存在以及他的造成的痛苦。

original: A faint hope but perhaps it shall stem the spread of his corruption, prevent more from infection.
string: 这或许能阻止他腐化的蔓延，防止更多人感染。

original: After that... I must move far away from this place.
string: 之后...我必须远离这个地方。

original: What? Why?
string: 什么？为什么？

original: He knows I am here, he has tried to turn my own friend against me. He will try again and again, I am certain of it.
string: 他知道我在这里，他曾试图让我的朋友背叛我。他会一再尝试，我对此深信不疑。

original: The longer I remain here, the more susceptible I am to his whims. If I do not leave, it shall spell the death of me.
string: 我留在这里的时间越长，我对他的依赖程度就越高。如果我不离开，那将意味着我的死亡。

original: I see.
string: 明白了。

original: He knows I am here, he has tried to turn my own friend against me. He will try again and again, I am certain of it.
string: 他知道我在这里，他曾试图让我的朋友背叛我。他会一再尝试，我对此深信不疑。

original: The longer I remain here, the more susceptible I am to his whims. If I do not leave, it shall spell the death of me.
string: 我留在这里的时间越长，我对他的依赖程度就越高。如果我不离开，那将意味着我的死亡。

original: I wish you luck. I'll visit you once again before you leave.
string: 祝你好运。在你离开之前我会再次拜访你。

original: I... thank you.
string: 我……谢谢你。

original: You have been good to me, I appreciate that.
string: 你对我很好，我感激不尽。

original: Is your book published?
string: 你的书出版了吗？

original: Indeed it is.
string: 当然。

original: A modest beginning, only a few have been made.  They carry my warnings, the danger of his temptation.
string: 刚开始，只制作了一些。它们带有我的警告，这种诱惑的危险。

original: Few shall read them, my reach still remains small. Time must first run its course.
string: 很少有人会读到它们，我的影响仍然很小。时间必须自行流逝。

original: Yet, the only reason it is in circulation is because of you. For that, I thank you dearly. For all you have done.
string: 然而，它现在被人熟知也是因为你。为此，我非常感谢你。为你的一切。

original: It's no issue.
string: 这没问题。

original: A humble response, but no less appreciated.
string: 一个谦逊的回答，但同样受欢迎。

original: A token of my gratitude.
string: 感谢之情。

original: Escaping Vile, do you think that is possible?
string: 逃离恶毒，你觉得那可能吗？

original: In truth, no.
string: 实际上，不。

original: I know my efforts for escape are futile. Vile shall one day find me and I'm certain it shall be the death of me, or worse...
string: 我知道我为逃脱的努力是徒劳的。维尔总有一天会找到我，我相信那将是我的死亡，或者更糟...

original: Perhaps this departure affords me... another decade more to live?
string: 也许这次离开给了我……又多了十年的生命？

original: The work I can publish in that time, the awareness I may raise, is far greater than me.
string: 在那段时间我能发布的作品，我可能引起的关注，远远超出了我本身。

original: And... what else am I fit for?
string: 还有，我还适合做什么？

original: Do you know where you'll go?
string: 你知道你要去哪吗？

original: Valenwood, in all likelihood.
string: 很可能是瓦伦伍德。

original: Its lush forest will keep me hidden, if but for a time. And the solitude it offers, no others will be forced to suffer by Vile's ire.
string: 这片郁葱的森林会让我短暂地隐匿其中。而它所提供的孤独，不会让其他人因为维尔的愤怒而受苦。

original: A long and arduous road I must travel but it shall be worth it.
string: 我必须走上一条漫长而艰难的道路，但这将是值得的。

original: I suppose this is farewell.
string: 我想这就是告别了。

original: Indeed.
string: 没错。

original: The work we did together, it was... we did the best we could.
string: 我们一起做的工作，那是……我们尽力而为。

original: Thank you, my friend. I shall miss your company, that I am certain of.
string: 谢谢你，我的朋友。我会想念与你在一起的时光，我对此深信不疑。

original: It's no issue. Goodbye.
string: 没事。再见。

original: Farewell. May your path lead to better roads.
string: 告别吧。愿你的道路通向更好的地方。

original: You said it'd give him a fresh start! What have you done?!
string: 你说这会给他一个新的开始！你到底做了什么？！

original: Look at him, that's as fresh as it can get!
string: 看他，就像刚出生的一样新鲜！

original: No memories of Cropsford, of his poor family, of me! A completely blank slate. Wonderful isn't it?
string: 对 克罗普斯福德，对他可怜的家人，对我没有任何记忆！一张完全空白的板。奇妙吧？

original: Bring him back.
string: 把他带回来。

original: I don't think you understand how this works.
string: 我想你并不明白这是如何进行的。

original: Our little friend is gone, no turning back.
string: 我们的小朋友走了，没有回头的可能。

original: Makes you wonder, if you didn't give him that book, what would he have done?
string: 让你想一想，如果你没有给他那本书，他会做什么？

original: Discover a new hobby? Move on with his life? Start a new family?
string: 发现了一项新的爱好？开始新的生活？组建新的家庭？

original: So many options, what would he have picked?
string: 这么多选择，他会选什么呢？

original: You're horrible, I can't believe what you've made me do.
string: 你太可怕了，我无法相信你让我做了什么。

original: I'm horrible? You're the one who gave him the book. No one else forced your hand, it's all on you my friend.
string: 我很糟糕？你才是给他那本书的人。没有别人逼迫你，全都是你自己的选择，我的朋友。

original: Now, as much as I'd love to stay and watch our little friend, I've got places to be.
string: 现在，虽然我很乐意留下来看着我们的小伙伴，但我已经有地方要去了。

original: Here, a parting gift from me.
string: 这里，送给你的离别礼物。

original: I do hope we meet one another again. This has been heaps of fun.
string: 我真心希望我们再次相遇。这真的很有趣。

original: Must you do this?!
string: 你一定要这么做吗？

original: You betray me!
string: 你背叛了我！

original: So be it. If that is what you wish.
string: 如果你希望如此，那就这样吧。

original: A shame, I had thought you were above this!
string: 真是一件悲哀的事，我曾以为你会高人一等！

original: I shan't let you do this!
string: 我不会让你这么做！

original: You were sent by him, weren't you!
string: 你是他派来的对吧！

original: You bastard! I let you into my home!
string: 可恶！我让你进了我的家！

original: After all we've been through, you do this?!
string: 我们经历了这一切，你居然这么做？！

original: Auriel curse you!
string: 奥瑞尔的诅咒降临于你！

original: I trusted you!
string: 我信任你！

original: Truly?
string: 真的吗？

original: I take no joy in this.
string: 我对此没有任何快感。

original: I'm sorry, it must be you!
string: 对不起，一定是你！

original: If you knew...
string: 如果你知道...

original: I won't lose myself, not this time!
string:
第999日光之月
阿姆尔听说有人召唤了克拉维可斯·维尔，说他会为雷姆斯找到一个治疗方法。我无法摆脱这一切都会出错的想法，也不愿意跟那个造成这一切的人的兄弟说话。但是，这似乎是我们唯一的机会。
第999日光之月，999E 999
自阿姆尔试图与迪德拉联系以来已经过去了几天，没有任何踪影。
最近我看到那老头经常在湖边走动。也许需要吓唬他，也许会让他重新考虑调查这件事。
第999日光之月
我们睡觉时有个满身泥巴的乞丐出现，甚至雷姆斯也没有听到他走路的声音。我们知道他是维尔的使者，当我醒来时，他站在我床边时已经很清楚了。
混蛋给出了自己的要求，说老头必须死，雷姆斯才能恢复人性。
我不认为我能让自己做到，必须与其他人商量。
<a_A>
我不会再迷失自己，这一次不会！

original: I can't go, I won't go!
string: 我不能走，我不会走！

original: Ugh!
string: 呃！

original: Why do this?!
string: 为什么要这么做？！

original: Auriel damn you!
string: 奥瑞尔该死你！

original: Agh!
string: 啊！

original: Ufgh!
string: 唔！

original: Damn you!
string: 去你妈的！

original: You won't get me!
string: 你毫无胜算！

original: Agh!
string: 啊！

original: Ugh!
string: 呃！

original: Ragh!
string: 啊！

original: Hargh!
string: 哈格！

original: Die you bastard!
string: 死吧混蛋！

original: Timer started
string: 计时器已开始

original: Mercenary disabled
string: 佣兵失能了

original: Killed Ulfgar
string: 杀死了乌尔夫加

original: Timer started
string: 计时器已开始

original: New dialogue, new farm
string: 新对话，新农场

original: The Devil's in the Details
string: 魔鬼在细节中

original: I stumbled across a cabin within the swamps of Morthal. Behind its door was a man who believed me to be someone else. If I wish to help the man within the cabin, I must persuade him of my innocence.
string: 我在墨索尔的沼泽中发现了一间小屋。在它的门后，有一个认为我是别人的人。如果我想帮助小屋里的这个人，我必须说服他我是清白的。

original: I have gained access to a secluded home within the swamps of Morthal. The man has invited me into his home; if I wish to learn more about his suspicions, I should speak with him further.
string: 我进入了墨索尔沼泽中一个隐秘的住所。这个男人邀请我进入他的家；如果我想了解更多关于他的猜疑，我应该进一步与他交谈。

original: I have gained access to a secluded home within the swamps of Morthal. The man has invited me into his home; if I wish to learn more about his suspicions, I should speak with him further.
string: 我进入了墨索尔沼泽中一个隐秘的住所。这个男人邀请我进入他的家；如果我想了解更多关于他的猜疑，我应该进一步与他交谈。

original: I spoke with Calithar, a scholar of the Daedric Prince Clavicus Vile. He attempted to recruit me into aiding those affected by the Prince but I declined. If I wish to help him in his quest, I should return to his home.
string: 我和卡利萨谈过，他是克拉维库斯·维尔的学者。他试图招募我去帮助那些受影响的人，但我拒绝了。如果我想要帮助他的事业，我应该回到他的家里。

original: After gaining access to Calithar's home, I learnt that he is a scholar of the Daedric Prince Clavicus Vile. I have agreed to help him in his mission of aiding those who dealt with the Prince. My first task is to investigate Starlight Farm, a homestead near Whiterun that suffered a recent tragedy.
string: 在进入卡利萨的家之后，我了解到他是迪德拉王子克拉维库斯·维尔的学者。我同意帮助他完成援助那些与王子打交道的人的使命。我的第一个任务是调查星光农场，那是一个近期发生悲剧的附近的住所。

original: I met the owner of Starlight Farm and have been asked to investigate his home. He is inconsolable with grief; clearly something significant has befallen the farm.
string: 我遇见了光辉农场的主人，并被要求调查他的家。他被丧失所困扰；显然，农场发生了重大事件。

original: I have found the corpse of the farmer's wife, Halva. I should return to him and inform him of what I've seen.
string: 我找到了农夫妻子哈尔瓦的尸体。我应该回去找他，告诉他我所看到的。

original: After speaking with the farmer, I learnt that he made a deal with a beggar, likely Clavicus Vile in disguise. He claims that the beggar granted him the wish of infinite food after all his crops grew rotten. When he returned to his homestead, he found his wife crushed to death with all the food. He asked me for one final wish: to be reunited with his wife, Halva. I will grant it.
string: 与这位农夫交谈后，我了解到他与一个乞丐达成了交易，很可能是变装成克拉维库斯·维尔的克拉维库斯。他声称那个乞丐在所有庄稼腐烂后赐予了他无限食物的愿望。当他回到农舍时，他发现他的妻子被所有食物压死了。他向我提出最后一个愿望：与他的妻子哈尔娃团聚。我会实现他的愿望。

original: After speaking with the farmer, I learnt that he made a deal with a beggar, likely Clavicus Vile in disguise. He claims that the beggar granted him the wish of infinite food after all his crops grew rotten. When he returned to his homestead, he found his wife crushed to death with all the food. He asked me for one final wish: to be reunited with his wife, Halva. I have done what he asked and should now return to Calithar and inform him of what happened.
string: 与农民交谈后，我获悉他与一个乞丐达成了协议，很可能是克拉维库斯·维尔伪装的。他声称那个乞丐在所有庄稼都腐烂后赐予了他无止境的食物之愿。当他回到家时，他发现他的妻子被压死在所有食物下面。他要求我一个最后的愿望：与他的妻子哈尔瓦团聚。我已经完成了他的要求，现在应该回到卡利萨并告诉他发生了什么。

original: After speaking with the farmer, I learnt that he made a deal with a beggar, likely Clavicus Vile in disguise. He claims that the beggar granted him the wish of infinite food after all his crops grew rotten. When he returned to his homestead, he found his wife crushed to death with all the food. He asked me for one final wish: to be reunited with his wife, Halva. I declined and urged him to find a new purpose. I should return to Calithar and inform him of all that happened.
string: 与农民交谈后，我得知他与一个乞丐达成了交易，可能是变着形色的克拉维库斯·维尔。他声称那个乞丐在他所有作物腐烂后许愿给他无穷无尽的食物。当他返回自己的家园时，发现妻子被所有食物压死。他向我许了最后一个愿望：与他的妻子哈尔瓦团聚。我拒绝了，并敦促他找到新的目标。我应该回到卡利萨那里，将发生的一切告诉他。

original: I informed Calithar of what befell the farmer, and he has handed me a drawing of what the beggar may have looked like. I should inspect it and inform him if it matches the description.
string: 我告知了卡莱萨发生在农民身上的事情，他给了我一个图画，显示了乞丐可能的相貌。我应该检查一下，然后告诉他是否符合描述。

original: I have been tasked with investigating a mercenary within Morthal's inn. He has reportedly been seen rising from the dead, with his body and mind intact. Calithar believes Vile has something to do with this.
string: 我被派去调查墨索尔附近的一个雇佣兵。据说他曾经死而复生，身心完好。卡莱萨认为维尔与此有关。

original: I learnt of Ulfgar's tragic story. After suffering a mortal wound, the beggar appeared before him and said if he wished it, he would recover from this injury and all others he'd come to sustain. Despite accepting the gift, Ulfgar still died. Not long after, he returned from death and reportedly lost a piece of himself. He claims this is the reason he abandoned his wife and child. He asked me to give a letter to both of them; I declined his request. I should return to Calithar and inform him of what I've learnt.
string: 我了解了乌尔夫加的悲惨故事。在遭受致命伤害后，乞丐出现在他面前，称如果他愿意，他将从这伤势和他即将遭受的所有其他伤势中恢复。尽管接受了这份礼物，乌尔夫加仍然死了。不久之后，他从死亡中复活，并据称失去了自己的一部分。他声称这是他抛弃妻子和孩子的原因。他请我给他们俩写封信；我拒绝了他的请求。我应该回去找卡利萨，告诉他我学到的东西。

original: I learnt of Ulfgar's tragic story. After suffering a mortal wound, the beggar appeared before him and said if he wished it, he would recover from this injury and all others he'd come to sustain. Despite accepting the gift, Ulfgar still died. Not long after, he returned from death and reportedly lost a piece of himself. He claims this is the reason he abandoned his wife and child. He asked me to give a letter to both of them; I have accepted this request and must now find them. He claims they reside somewhere in Whiterun.
string: 我得知了乌尔夫加的悲惨故事。在遭受致命伤后，一个乞丐出现在他面前说，如果他愿意的话，他将从这个伤势和他攒下来的所有伤势中康复。尽管接受了这份礼物，乌尔夫加仍然去世了。不久后，他从死亡中复活，并据报道失去了自己的一部分。他声称这是他抛弃妻子和孩子的原因。他让我给他们俩写信；我接受了这个请求，现在必须找到他们。他声称他们住在白漫的某个地方。

original: After hearing Ulfgar's tragic story, I granted his request of delivering a letter to his wife and child. When I eventually found his daughter, she was living on the streets and informed me of her mother's death. I told her of her father's cowardice and handed her the letter. I should return to Ulfgar and tell him of his wife's death.
string: 听完乌尔夫加的悲惨故事后，我答应了他将信交给妻子和孩子的请求。当我最终找到他的女儿时，她正在街上生活，告诉我她母亲已经去世。我告诉她关于她父亲懦弱的事情，并交给了她那封信。我应该回去见乌尔夫加，告诉他他妻子去世的消息。

original: After hearing Ulfgar's tragic story, I granted his request of delivering a letter to his wife and child. When I eventually found his daughter, she was living on the streets and informed me of her mother's death. I told her that her father was dead and handed her the letter. I should return to Ulfgar and tell him of his wife's death.
string: 听完乌尔夫加悲惨的故事后，我答应将一封信交给他的妻子和孩子。当我最终找到他的女儿时，她已经过着流浪生活，并告诉我她母亲已经去世。我告诉她她父亲也去世了，并递给她这封信。我应该回去告诉乌尔夫加她妻子去世的消息。

original: I have granted Ulfgar's request and should inform Calithar of all I've learnt. He's sure to be interested in the mercenary's dealings.
string: 我已经答应了乌尔夫加的请求，应该告知卡里萨尔我所学到的一切。他一定对雇佣兵的交易很感兴趣。

original: After informing Calithar of Ulfgar's tale, he has set me to investigate a veteran of the Great War. He reportedly lost the use of his legs during his time in combat but miraculously gained the ability to walk not long ago. He is now apparently missing, and I have been tasked with locating him.
string: 在告诉卡利萨有关乌尔夫加的故事后，他让我调查了一位大战老兵。据称他在战斗中失去了双腿的运动能力，但不久前奇迹般地又能够行走。现在他显然失踪了，我被要求找到他。

original: I have found a journal located within the veteran's house. Its contents mention a nearby cave he intended to investigate. If I wish to discover what befell the man, I should head there immediately.
string: 我在老兵的房子里找到了一本日记。里面提到了一个他打算调查的附近洞穴。如果我想了解发生在这个人身上的事，我应该立即前往那里。

original: I have found the remains of the veteran. I read the journals within his home and learnt of the deal he struck with Clavicus Vile. For a time, he gained the use of a magical prosthesis that allowed him to walk once again. After a year, Vile took the use of this prosthetic away and left the veteran stranded in his hunting grounds. I found his corpse mauled and near unrecognisable. I should return to Calithar and inform him of what I've seen.
string: 我找到了老兵的遗骸。我阅读了他家中的日志，得知了他与克拉维库斯·维尔达成的交易。有一段时间，他得到了使用魔法义肢的机会，让他能够再次行走。一年后，维尔夺走了这个义肢的使用权，让老兵被困在了他的狩猎领地里。我发现他的尸体被撕裂得近乎难以辨认。我应该回到卡利萨那里，告诉他我所见到的一切。

original: I learnt of Calithar's tragic past and the reason he continues to study Vile. He has asked me to leave his cabin; I should return tomorrow and see how he fares.
string: 我知道卡莱萨悲惨的过去，以及他继续研究维尔的原因。他让我离开他的小屋；明天我应该回去看看他过得如何。

original: It has been a day since Calithar told me of his past life. I should check up on him and see if he has another job for me.
string: 距离卡利萨告诉我他的过去已经过去了一天。我应该去看看他，看看他是否有别的工作给我。

original: Outside of Calithar's cabin sat the Beggar. He tried to convince me to give the scholar a new start, one free from the memories of his family. I declined this deal and must now tell Calithar of what has transpired.
string: 在卡利萨的小屋外坐着那个乞丐。他试图说服我，给那位学者一个新的开始，摆脱家庭记忆。我拒绝了这个交易，现在必须告诉卡利萨所发生的事。

original: Outside of Calithar's cabin sat the Beggar. He spoke of feeling remorse over what he had done to the scholar's family. He has tasked me with giving Calithar a book that will give him a new start in life. I must convince him to read the book without raising suspicion.
string: 在卡利萨的小屋外，乞丐坐在那里。他表示对自己对学者家庭所做的事感到懊悔。他让我给卡利萨一本书，这将给他一个新的人生开始。我必须说服他在不引起怀疑的情况下阅读这本书。

original: Given him the book
string: 给了他那本书

original: I gave Calithar the Beggar's book, and he has seemingly lost his mind. He cannot speak or move around and simply stands there. I must confront Vile and make him pay for what he did to Calithar.
string: 我把乞丐书给了古丽萨，他似乎已经失去了理智。他无法说话或移动，只是站在那里。我必须面对邪恶，让他为他对古丽萨所做的事付出代价。

original: I confronted the Beggar about what he did to Calithar, and he held no remorse. I have been tricked by Vile one final time. In his parting words, he gave me a ring for my efforts. A pitiful reward for my journey with Calithar.
string: 我质问了那个乞丐关于他对卡利萨的所做所为，他毫无愧疚。我最终又一次被维尔愚弄了。在告别的最后一句里，他给了我一个戒指以示劳苦功高。对我与卡利萨的旅程来说，这是一个卑微的奖励。

original: I told Calithar of what the Beggar said to me. Fearing further tricks or retribution, he has made the decision to publish his findings and leave Skyrim altogether. He must first prepare his belongings, and then he will be ready to leave. I should speak to him one last time before he departs.
string: 我告诉了加利瑟关于乞丐对我说的事情。担心会有更多的把戏或报复，他决定公开他的发现并彻底离开天际。他必须先准备好他的物品，然后就可以离开了。在他离开之前，我应该再和他谈一次。

original: Calithar should have all his belongings ready for departure. I should return to his cabin and speak to him once more.
string: 卡利萨应该已经准备好了他的所有物品准备离开。我应该回到他的小屋，再次与他交谈。

original: Calithar should have all his belongings ready for departure. I should return to his cabin and speak to him once more.
string: 卡利萨应该已经准备好了他的所有物品准备离开。我应该回到他的小屋，再次与他交谈。

original: I spoke with Calithar a final time. We reminisced on our work together and the people we tried to help. In a final gesture of goodwill, he gave me an ornate ring forged from jade. I've seen him wearing it before, and I'm certain it contains some sentimental value to him. A fitting reward for our journey together.
string: 我与卡利萨最后谈话。我们回忆起我们一起工作的事情，以及我们尝试帮助的人。作为最后的善意姿态，他送给了我一枚由翡翠打造的华丽戒指。我之前见他戴过，我确定对他而言有一定的情感价值。这是我们一起旅行的恰当奖励。

original: I spoke with Calithar a final time. We reminisced on our work together and the people we tried to help. In a final gesture of goodwill, he gave me an ornate ring forged from jade. I've seen him wearing it before, and I'm certain it contains some sentimental value to him. A fitting reward for our journey together.
string: 我与卡利萨最后谈话。我们回忆起我们一起工作的事情，以及我们尝试帮助的人。作为最后的善意姿态，他送给了我一枚由翡翠打造的华丽戒指。我之前见他戴过，我确定对他而言有一定的情感价值。这是我们一起旅行的恰当奖励。

original: Despite Calithar's warnings, I attempted to kill Ulfgar the Risen. After a few moments of uncertainty, I witnessed him rise from the dead and return to life. Despite this miracle, he now refuses to speak with me due to my actions. Whatever rapport I had built with Calithar is now gone. I should avoid his cabin at all costs.
string: 尽管卡利萨警告过我试图杀死复生的乌尔夫加。在犹豫了几分钟后，我看到他从死亡中奇迹般复活。尽管这种奇迹，他现在拒绝与我交谈，因为我的行动。我和卡利萨建立的关系已不复存在。我应该尽量避开他的小屋。

original: I confronted the Beggar about what he did to Calithar, and he held no remorse. I have been tricked by Vile one final time. In his parting words, he gave me a ring for my efforts. A pitiful reward for my journey with Calithar.
string: 我质问了那个乞丐关于他对卡利萨的所做所为，他毫无愧疚。我最终又一次被维尔愚弄了。在告别的最后一句里，他给了我一个戒指以示劳苦功高。对我与卡利萨的旅程来说，这是一个卑微的奖励。

original:
As your eyes gaze upon the contents of the book, something irreparably changes within you. A reduction or an addition, you cannot tell, but its presence alone brings you to your knees. Your vision begins to blur, and one by one, each sound is slowly drowned out with a deafening silence. Soon, that is all that fills your ears. As you attempt to salvage what little of yourself remains and pull your eyes from the page, the realisation dawns on you. 
You are nothing.
string: 当你的眼睛注视着书的内容，你内心发生了无法挽回的改变。是减少还是增加，你说不清，但仅仅它的存在就让你跪倒。你的视野开始模糊，所有声音逐渐被一种震耳欲聋的寂静淹没。很快，这就是你耳中唯一的声音。当你试图挽救自己剩下的一点点和把目光从页面上移开时，你意识到了。你什么都不是。
